Star Trek: Phoenix
Earth Spacedock / promenade
Deleted User 16-Jan-20 09:44 PM
A certain counsellor had watched the Phoenix slowly arrive into Earth Spacedock - those partaking in the court martial had been shipped off early to return to Earth, the Phoenix catching up with them later. Said certain counsellor had been there for the court martial; listening, not partaking, not being allowed to. Said certain counsellor had been the one building the defence for those on trial. She had compiled all of the evidence, the crew's service records, scientific analyses, notation on their mental health... All of her work went unnoticed as always, never attributed to her... And as always, she didnt mind. As long as she could help. For now she remained gazing out of the window, watching the ship dock with the space station. Wheelchair-bound and semi-paralysed, there was no way that this certain counsellor was even supposed to be working... But nothing was going to get in the way of her helping this crew. She remained seated there; watching, waiting. She new that one of them would come for her help, eventually. She would be there for them.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 16-Jan-20 10:21 PM
Alaya wandered into the promenade, immediately wincing at the noise due to the amount of people wandering around, there were so many people. This was a bad idea, she knew she should have stayed on the ship. She would try to make her way over the the side of the promenade towards one of the windows, where it was a bit less crowded, maybe if she just looked out the window for long enough she'd forgot everyone else was there... She took a deep breath and pushed through the crowd. (edited)
Deleted User 16-Jan-20 10:34 PM
Phenna had immediately taken note of the sudden spike in emotion, coming from... Somewhere behind her, standing out from the crowd. Intense emotions were easy for her to pick out and latch onto - and the fear radiating from that person immediately concerned her... Plus she recognised this person's emotional signature, and it was easier to hear those who she already knew. Instinctively she reached out, extending her influence... Testing her limits. There was no way she would be heard through all of this noise, after all... 'It's alright, Lieutenant Shilen. Calm. You're safe here,' she softly conveyed telepathically to the woman... And then realised why she was supposed to steer away from mental communication with a non-telepath when the headache started. Whoops.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 16-Jan-20 10:38 PM
Alaya seemed confused, she heard her councillors voice in her head, was this actually her, or just some form of memory trying to keep her calm? Nevertheless her emotional state seemed to calm immediately at Phenna's words. She let out another deep breath, and eventually managed to manoeuvre herself towards an empty space of window. 'I'm trying, Phenna... Believe me I am.'
Deleted User 16-Jan-20 10:43 PM
"I know, sweetheart," she then stated verbally, being sat just slightly further down from Shilen, watching the spacetraffic out of the windows through eyes which were still vaguely hazy. "You don't need to tell anyone that you're trying. We know you are, and you're doing perfectly well."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 16-Jan-20 10:45 PM
She glaced over at the words, and gave her a big smile, making her way over to her "Admiral Ephrix! I didn't expect to actually see you here... You've recovered from you incident?"
Deleted User 16-Jan-20 10:48 PM
"I'm getting there," she replied, turning her wheelchair at an angle so she could look to Shilen. In an instant, she had matched the Bajoran's smile. "How are you? Coming over here is a big step for you - might I ask what spurred that on..?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 16-Jan-20 10:49 PM
She made her way over to Phenna, sitting down on the window ledge so she was of a similar height to Phenna in her wheelchair "I don't know, I'm starting to regret it slightly..." She said with a slight chuckle "I decided I should probably go socialise with other people."

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 02:25 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 17-Jan-20 02:25 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 02:43 PM
[D] For a while now, coming from further down the promenade, there had been live music being played. About five minutes ago it had stopped with the last strum of an electric guitar reverberating throughout the entirety of the station. Now, there was the sound of chatting coming along the corridor, bickering and laughing before suddenly harmonising into a perfectly in-tune, "oh! I wanna know - if you want to be my girlfriend! ...I heard, somebody say - that you want to be my girlfriend!" Just as they had broken off into a fit of laughter, a group rounded the corridor. Two Vulcan girls walked backwards to talk to the four guys who had seemingly harmonised to sing to them, both shaking their heads. All of the group were carrying masses of equipment; amps, microphone stands, guitar cases. The shortest of the group who was walking to the far right - closest to the window, looked to his friend and laughed, "h-how many times do they h-have to say, Jihan, that they're n-n-not interested!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 02:48 PM
Alaya had glanced round at the sound of people approaching, she was kinda curious, but decided she would be better not to try and make a fool of herself again by trying to talk to so many people
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 02:53 PM
"H-Hey, I'm g-going to take all of my k-kit back to the ship. M-Might as well free up some s-space at your place, J-Jiha! I can c-catch up later, maybe? Before I l-leave?" The shortest one then asked, having stopped when the others kept trying to talk and walk onwards. Kennox, despite loving the company of his friends - and enjoying the heck out of the collab between his band and the two others - was eager to get back aboard again... The Bajoran who seemed to be in charge of the group gave a thumbs up and almost dropped his guitar case. "Sure thing, Kenny, T'Prai and T'Hrai here are just about to go on a sweet date with me anyway, huh ladies! Oi, lads, don't get jealous now... We'll see you later!" He gave the short one a wave as he walked on and promptly dropped the guitar case. One of the Vulcans shook her head and picked it up for him, looking unimpressed. Kennox matched her shake of the head, but looked more amused. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 02:59 PM
Alaya looked over at the young Cadet, seeing the rest of the group and smiled at him, waving him over, he looked like somebody who she could talk to.
KardasXRT 17-Jan-20 03:00 PM
From afar, the Jem'hadar officer watched - sometimes he'd be offered that kind of camaraderie by his classmates back at the Academy; each and every time he'd declined, sometimes with more aggression than others. Even now, finding it seemed difficult, and rightly so. He simply let out a dry, half amused chuckle and started off down the hallway.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:01 PM
Upon seeing the woman in operations yellow beckon him over, he re-arranged his equipment to secure his grasp on it all and headed over. "H-Hello, m-ma'am. What can I d-d-do for y-you?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:04 PM
Alaya smiled to him, nervously "Sorry to bother you. I just noticed you walking with your friends there... I'm looking a tad lonely over here by myself..." She let out a quiet chuckle, rubbing the back of her head, awkwardly "You wouldn't happen to be Cadet Ephrix, would you? Denobulan and Betazoid doesn't seem like a very common mix."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:06 PM
"You k-k-know about me?" He all but squeaked, looking completely and utterly shocked. Oh no, what had he done this time? Why did this officer know about him? Oh, no, he was about to get in trouble already wasn't he? Was this what he got for replicating way too much hot chocolate in the run-up to exams? Oh no...
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:08 PM
"Don't look so nervous, Cadet. I knew your aunt from my academy days. I've heard a lot of the crew talk about you when she was recovering. They have very high opinions of you. I'm just upset to hear you had left the ship before I arrived. I'm Leuitenant Shilen, I'm the newly assigned assistant chief operations officer on the Phoenix."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:09 PM
"O-Oh!" He laughed, immediately brightening up... Clearly thankful that he wasn't in trouble. He held out a hand. "It's a p-p-pleasure to m-meet you, m-ma'am! I th-thought I was in t-trouble, there!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:11 PM
Alaya laughed, shaking the cadets hand "Who could be angry with somebody as cute and innocent as you?" She said with a smile. "How did your examinations go?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:15 PM
The poor cadet immediately blushed and rubbed the back of his head sheepishly, tousling his already curly, straw-ginger hair. "Why t-thank you, m-ma'am, although I'm sure some l-lecturers would disagree! And they were a j-j-journey. Th-There's no w-way I haven't passed, n-not like I'm b-bragging or anything, but we d-did save an invigelator's l-life, so..."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:17 PM
"Oh wow. That sounds like an interesting story! What happened? Are they alright?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:21 PM
He set down his keyboard case to clap his hands together. "So. We're about... F-Fifteen minutes towards the end of the theory exam. This i-invigelator has been pacing up and down, y-you know, as they do... And as he h-has, his breathing has been getting m-more and m-more heavy. He pauses at the top, p-puts a hand on the top of his desk... And d-drops."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:23 PM
"That's not good! People aren't meant to do that." She said with a light chuckle
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:28 PM
"E-Exactly! Now, all of my class k-know their stuff... But who has the most p-practice because our ship is a d-danger magnet? M-Me. So I run over, go through D-DRCABC. Invigelator isn't b-breathing. I send Jan to call for help b-because she's pretty quick, K'Neish and S'Von to get kit because they're fast and s-strong. I get started on m-manual chest compressions and rescue breaths. They g-get back with kit and at the two minute mark I s-swap with Oshek. I'm c-coordinating them all; 5ccs of cordrazine, d-defib on, c-ortical stimulator on, 10ccs of epinephrine, igel s-sized, a-airway in, suction ready, IV in, everything."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:30 PM
"Woah! That's so impressive, Cadet! I'm so incredibly proud of you for co-ordinating all that. I'm sure your aunt would be incredibly proud of you too." (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:34 PM
He laughed, but the smile was still there. "E-Everyone I've spoken to keeps saying that they're proud. I was just d-doing my job. We got ROSC at about f-fifteen minutes, agonal breathing only, kept going for another fifteen... Until we got a p-proper return, suction in... Got the patient s-stable. We had done everything before actual medics had a-arrived; all they had to do was a P-PTS!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:40 PM
"I... Don't know what half of this means, but I'm sure it's clearly describing how amazing you are?" She gave the cadet a cheesy smile "I look forward to having such a capable and experienced medic onboard."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:42 PM
"Awh man..." He chuckled and rubbed the back of his head again. "And I thought that the p-praise from everyone else was g-good, but they have n-nothing on you, ma'am!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:43 PM
"Please, Cadet. Call me Alaya. We're friends now, you got that?" She said, giving him a heartwarming smile.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:45 PM
"A-Alright, A-A-Alaya. Thank you! In th-that case, please c-call me Kennox. Everyone else d-does. No one knows me as C-Cadet Ephrix, it's like... A f-family thing. F-First names only."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:46 PM
"Kennox. You got it. See, how nice is this? Making new friends. You're as heartwarming and friendly as your aunt. I like you, Kennox." She said with a nod of approval
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:50 PM
"P-People compare me w-with the Admiral a l-lot. We uh... H-Have similar personalities, but I'm w-way too shy to ever c-climb the ranks like s-she did," he replied with a laugh. Literally as he was taking about the comparison, he was doing exactly as Phenna would - dissecting Alaya's speech. 'How nice is this - making new friends...' Kennox had no qualms against making new friends, which meant Alaya was saying it to herself in reassurance. Interesting.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:52 PM
"With such good leadership skills as yours, I'm sure you'll do amazing things. Leading a whole team of people to help your invigilator? That takes a good amount of leadership, I think that'll do you great help in future."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:55 PM
"Well, thank you, m-ma'am! I'm c-certainly going to try my best." He paused, looking up at her. "D-Did you come over to ESD for anything in p-particular, ma'am? I k-know the place quite well, I can p-point you in the right direction..."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:56 PM
"I came over to socialise. Immediately regretted that decision though... I've kinda been sitting here for, who knows how long. Just watching the world go bye."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 03:57 PM
"There are a l-lot of people, and I suppose we d-didn't help, making a total racket!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 03:58 PM
"I've never been the biggest fan of people, especially lots of them. You're aunt would be able to back that up. But I do honestly try my best."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 04:05 PM
"Well, t-t-talking to me is proof of that, m-ma'am, and t-trying is always what matters!"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 04:07 PM
She laughed, and put a hand on his knee "Alaya, and yes. I'm certainly a lot better at talking to people than I used to be. You're certainly quite good at talking to people, despite the fact you're meant to be the quiet and shy one." (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 04:11 PM
"Eh, I'm f-fine once I get talking... And by that I mean, you'll n-never be able to get me to sh-shut up!" He laughed.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 04:13 PM
She laughed with him, something about this kid was just so damn enjoyable "That's not a bad thing. Honestly, I could talk to you all day, Kennox. You and your aunt have that in common as well, you're both so easy to just talk to. Must be an Ephrix thing."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 04:24 PM
"It d-d-definitely is. You should h-hear my dad go on, and on, and on... He could t-t-talk for Wales, he could."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 04:25 PM
"If he's half as nice as you, I could listen to him talk for hours." She smiled "Were you taking your stuff back to the ship, Kennox?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 04:34 PM
"That's r-r-right, ma'am. I've had it all at a f-friends house, but I might as well t-take it back aboard now that I'll be h-headed out with the crew again."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 04:35 PM
"Would you like me to accompany you back to the ship?" She phrased it as if he was the one who needed help to get back, but really she was the one dying to get off of the starbase. He could probably sense her eagerness to leave.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 04:37 PM
And, in typical skilled empath fashion, he saw right through it. Despite that, though, he gave her a smile. "That w-would be helpful, ma'am, t-thank you." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 17-Jan-20 05:10 PM
She laughed, giving the cadet a smile "Come on then, Kennox." She stood, waiting for him to join her
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 17-Jan-20 05:13 PM
He picked up the equipment he was carrying and sauntered off after her to the #deleted-channel.

She turned around so that her face was visible to the ACTO. And the resemblance to Maggie was insane. This woman looked like a older version of her fellow ACTO

4
Miel 27-Mar-20 10:58 PM
Nira's eyes widened when they fell upon the familiar silhouette. There just was no mistaking it, she looked too much like Maggie.. Without saying anything, the Romulan made her way through the crowd toward the older woman.
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:00 PM
She was chatting to a older man in a command uniform. She smiled deceitfully at the man.. “Of course Captain Lowry, I’ll see you on the Rose tomorrow.” He nodded and walked off, with Tina giving a small wave. She hadn’t seen Nira yet...
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:02 PM
The Romulan was not sure why, but she had an innate desire to stap the woman in the back and disappear in the crowd. She, of course, did no such thing, simply approaching the woman. "Commander Tina Roode?" She asked out loud once she was close enough.
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:04 PM
She sighed as she turned around. Looking at Nira with a questioning glare. “Yes... Lieutenant? Are you here to waste my time like all the other junior staff that talk to me.”
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:08 PM
Nira crossed her arms behind her back, standing at her tallest despite her much shorter size. She could feel her heart beating at breakneck speed. Stupid injury.. "No, I'll be quite brief. I know how abusive you are toward your daughter. I also know that what you now say with your poisonous words, you used to say with your hands and fist when she was too young to defend yourself. If you ever threaten her again, I swear I will drag you through every single courts that will hear me until I can be sure you'll never serve on a startship or see your daughter again. You're not her family anymore, we are."
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:13 PM
She raises her eyebrow. “Unexpected for..a Romulan. But truly dear I couldn’t care less what you think and say. I don’t know how you know about that, but I will say this. I was only preparing my daughter for the real world and Starfleet. I wasn’t soft in my parenting I know, but at least I wasn’t over protective like other parents. At least she had free will, I had to show her what was right and what was wrong. Sorry if that doesn’t fit into your closed mind set Lieutenant.”
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:16 PM
Nira took a few steps forward, her gaze never wavering. "No. What you did your whole life is taking out your frustration about your own failures and shortcomings and taking it out on the only person who would never fight back. You never cared about how she felt, and never tried teaching her right from wrong. You are a vile, despisable human being, and I'm glad that Maggie learned nothing, nothing from you."
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:21 PM
Tina felt her left hand form into a fist on instinct...oh this would be fun. “Lieutenant. I’ve had enough of your ships bullshit. I understand that you’re all mighty hero’s that had saved the Federation. But truthfully I don’t give a damn about what high you’re on from constant praise, you are lucky. But stay out of me and my daughters business, and I should we telling that to that Andorian bitch, but that can wait.”
7
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:25 PM
She took another step, arms still crossed behind her back. "Your daughter is, indeed a hero, commanded many times now for her heroic actions in the civil war. While you should show pride, you only show pettiness and jealousy. Do you despise yourself so much, having enver done much in your career to deserve such praise that you always have to belittle your own daughter? You are a racist, abusive woman, Commander. And I can assure you, everyone will know about it soon enough."
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:28 PM
She sighed. Raising her hand dramatically... “You want to be hit like I hit Maggie, I’d suggest you shut up Lieutenant. And no, I don’t give a damm about the consequences if it means shutting you up...”
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:29 PM

Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:31 PM

4
4
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:34 PM
Nira's head turned hard when she received the slap, and she did take a step back. The noise and commotion was enough to gather the attention of a few people in the crowd, and the orange mark on Nira's cheek glowed with heat. She started breathing heavily, massive pangs of pains flaring in her chest. She turned her head back toward the woman. "ESD Security should be on their way soon, Commander. You should really keep your anger in check in crowded areas."
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:36 PM
She chuckled.. “Oh all right dear. Do tell Maggie I said hi, a night in the brig shouldn’t be too much for me. But just remember, Maggie is my daughter, and I will do as i please towards her.”
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:40 PM
"Be assured you will not be spending just a night in the brig. If you come into contact with her again, I'll unleash all hell upon you." She moved a bit closer to the woman as Officers in yellow walked in, taking statements from the witnesses. Nira whispered softly, making sure only Tina could hear. "You have no idea." She said before backing away. A security officer walked to Tina and another one to Nira, separating the two. Nira was brought a few feet away, the officer asking her if she was okay. The Romulan nodded, explaining what happened and rubbing her injured cheek. While the guard offered to take her to the medical facilities, she declined, explaining she'd go to the sickbay on her own ship asap.
Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:42 PM
She laughed as overheard Nira’s last words to her, smiling at the security officer.. “I hit her.” Was all she said, feeling quite proud of herself.
Miel 27-Mar-20 11:44 PM

Commander Tina Roode BOT 27-Mar-20 11:45 PM

The prime directive, is to protect the people, that is why we follow it. The federation ordered us to do our duties, we are not to protect them and them alone, we are to protect what it means to be apart of the federation. Captain Syrezeaju 25-Jun-20 10:29 PM
A'aerhel quite enjoyed Earth Spacedock. The majority of her time was spent on Earth at Intelligence - not to disclose the main headquarters' location, of course - or aboard one of their few starships. Not as if the division had many. When you were in regular Starfleet you had multiple different divisions to take staff from and use them to fill a ship. At Intelligence you only had the one, and it was not as if they had a large number of staff either. It was nice to get out every once in a while and enjoy the view somewhere else. The place always had a pleasant atmosphere. Even if it did not look like it going by that steely external gaze, she did enjoy it here. At present she did not have time to stop and idly take in the sights or browse through the stores, though. The request from Commander-turned-Captain Kunzō had been unexpected but pleasant. A'aehrel presumed it was something to do with their joint mission. As much as she hated to admit it, she had rather enjoyed working aboard the Phoenix with that crew. It was a shame she had not had the chance to get to talk with them further. Starfleet vessels had such a different atmosphere to the ones she had served upon before. The Tal Shiar and Zhat Vash were strictly business only. Intelligence was alright but there was always the air of caution that haunted the place. Aboard regular vessels you did not have that issue. People were free to become friends and not worry about the consequences of utilising free time. It gave them the opportunity for growth - something that she had always yearned for. As she paced along the promenade to the allocated airlock she passed Sharissa and Shilen. The two were met with a nod of acknowledgement, having recognised the two from the vessel that she was now headed towards. On the way she caught word of a 'wedding' - naturally overhearing conversations was still a bad habit of hers. A wedding, though. Fascinating...

"Oh... Really? You're not like... Dressing up for your own wedding?" She said with a confused smile. "Most of your guests will look better than you will..."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jun-20 01:13 PM
[Shar]"Oh! You mean that..." She went a dark shade of blue, antennae forming question marks, which looked weird. "No. Not yet! Not really anyway. We gotta talk about that still..."
Knightlife2 26-Jun-20 01:17 PM
"Prophets, Shar... You really had me confused there!" She said with a laugh "So, start again? Are you wearing purple and orange to the wedding?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jun-20 01:18 PM
[Shar]"Don't know. We'll have to see. But I might still go in something orange. I love orange."
Knightlife2 26-Jun-20 07:00 PM
"Purple and Orange do seem quite out there. Do you not fancy something more... I don't want to say boring, but maybe less out there?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jun-20 07:01 PM
[Shar]"Not really! I don't mind putting myself out there if you know what I mean! Just because I'm half and half and technically shouldn't exist doesn't mean that I should hide away. Y'know? I like to think I have a bright personality and I don't mind people knowing."
Knightlife2 26-Jun-20 07:14 PM
"Well if you think so." She said with a smile "Let's go relax."

The restaraunt was not so far away, and the smell of sweet sticky rice and makapa was enough to whet her hunger.

"Well, my personal favorite is a hybrid dish that's common in a lot of Bajoran food places. I like their sweet sticky rice with pineapple, and sweet-chili Porli-bird. It's served with a soft milk bread called Makapa to ease the burn a bit. But if you are not fond of spice, maybe something like Decapus salad? Or Gorlanda stew with the same sticky rice?"

She couldn't stand feeling stuck or blocked, and she was sure Maleb was the same. This all, of course, she was keeping from Sara to the best of her ability. The last thing they needed was for her to worry.

She thought for a moment before holding the cup out to him. "I haven't taken a sip yet, would you like to try?" (edited)

L. King 12-Aug-20 06:54 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:54 AM
"That's very fair, but the offer stands until I start eating.. in case you want to try- but don't want to waste an entire cup." Ding! A call out for their number. "Ah, that was kinda fast! I will go grab our food, would you three mind picking a table, please?" (edited)
L. King 12-Aug-20 06:56 AM
Sa'val assumed she had meant Maleb, and went to assist in collecting the plates, curious about the appearance of the meal he had ordered...or more accurately Sara had ordered.

Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:59 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:59 AM
Sara gave Sa'val a smile and a quiet whisper of thanks as she walked over to the counter with him, trading in the ticket for two platters of food. The first was an enormous panini-style sandwich with an ooze of white cheese coming out either side and a side of some sort of fried...item. The second was two dishes, both bowls, one with a thick, hearty soup with a deep brown gravy and a side of rice, and the second bowl with same sort of rice, but with brightly-orange colored meat with a heavy red glaze, a large slice of bread off to the side for both dishes.
She picked up the first one as it was slightly lighter than the one with the two heavy bowls.
"Thanks for playing muscles, it might have been dinner and a show to watch me bring both though~"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:06 AM
T'Pel sat across from Maleb, but said nothing. It was kind of nice just quietly being around someone else who could possibly understand her special brand of awkward. In fact, she wished they could get closer. She missed that connection she had with her brother, even though he was her opposite and often did his best to annoy her. But Maleb was more like her. Duty and discipline. She inwardly sighed, letting the thought drift away as she eyed a few of the closer shops.
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:06 AM
"It is necessary to play to my strengths..." Sa'val eyed the meals, not quite drooling. He spent extra time checking out the bright orange colored meat and red glaze, convinced it might be his. "...though the alternative does sound intriguing." Sa'val picked up the trays. (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:08 AM
Maleb was pretty much oblivious to T'Pel's feelings as he looked around the room, keeping an eye on Sa'val and Sara in case they needed help. Ah, he hated crowds. "It is rather loud on the station, isn't it?" (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:09 AM
"Ah, but what if I tripped and fell? Then you'd have to wait even longer for your food." She was quiet for a second before responding in a distressed tone. "And I would too."
Shaking her head, she nodded for him to follow her as she joined T'Pel and Maleb at the table, seating herself next to T'Pel- as she would be sharing out of the same dish.
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:12 AM
T'Pel glanced at Maleb, "In more ways than one." She agreed, and just then Sara had joined them.
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:12 AM
Sa'val followed and set the trays down in front of them, doing his best to guess which dish belonged to whom.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:13 AM
"I am so excited! I had accidentally skipped breakfast and I believe we had about another 12 minutes before I became a totally different person."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:14 AM
"Ah. The most famous of human emotions. Hanger." T'Pel smirked.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:14 AM
Sara set the stew and rice in front of Maleb, taking special caution to touch from the bottom and not the rim. The other bowl was set between herself and T'Pel, and the panini meal was placed in front of Sa'val. Condiments, napkins, and silverware were already in the middle of the table.
"I get it very badly, actually."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:14 AM
Maleb did his best to help guide the heavy-looking trays down onto the table, to make sure there was no spilling. "Thank you." "...What do you mean? What is hanger?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:15 AM
"It is when someone is so hungry they become intolerable."
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:15 AM
Sa'val smirked his usual smirk, once again. "Curse my human side for having inherited that trait." Sa'val was curious about the panini. It looked delicious.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:15 AM
"It's a cross of emotions between hunger and anger. It's a type of frustration only solved with food."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:16 AM
"Hunger is not exactly an emotion. But anger from lack of food is a primal instinct designed to force you to get sustenance anyway possible."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:17 AM
Taking a fork-like utensil from the middle of the table, she portioned out a bit of the rice and sweet-chili meat from the bowl and transferred it onto an extra plate, sliding it to T'Pel with a smile. "You may have half the bread too if you like!"
"Humans are egregiously simple humanoids, Maleb, I will be the first to admit it. We unfortunately can't repress some of our baser instincts, but it makes for an interesting collection of quirks." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:19 AM
"Ah... How unusual an emotion. Yet somewhat logical, in a primal way." Maleb said as he picked up a spoon. "I do not believe that 'simple' can be accurately applied to humans."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:21 AM
T'Pel grabbed a spoon and poked at the food a moment, letting it's aroma fill her nose, before taking a small bite.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:21 AM
"You think so? Whenever I've been talked down to by an alien, it's always been with some combination of simple-minded or ugly. I do not take it to heart obviously- but it can be true in some ways. But in that same breath- all species have certain bits they are not proud of..it's a two way street."
"A lot of humans have simple wants, but it does not mean simple-minded."
Sara took a bite of her food, rolling her eyes back in a strange mixture of delight and relief, swallowing before she had thoroughly chewed. "Like good food."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:24 AM
"The shameful often like to shame to deflect from the object of their...shame." T'Pel added, taking another bite.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:26 AM
"Humans may be more generalist than other more specialized species, but that does not make them simple. Humans are very diverse and complicated, in my experience." Maleb said as he tried some of his food. "A most fascinating dish."
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:27 AM
"Some of us are fine being simple..." Sa'val took a messy bite of the panini.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:27 AM
"A species as a whole is only what you make of it. If you keep a preserved, isolated view of a culture, it will always feel strange and foreign- as opposed to immersing yourself and experiencing it for better or for worse."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:30 AM
"Indeed. It is logical to try to understand other cultures as much as possible, whether it means socializing with others, trying new foods, or reading literature, to select a few examples. To isolate is to grow to hate."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:30 AM
"See? You get it."
Sara nodded and took another bite of her meal, relief still etched onto her features.
"But I also agree with Sa'val, it's also okay to be simple. You don't need to be an enigma to be interesting or fun." (edited)
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:33 AM
"Agreed."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:34 AM
"It is not only my responsibility as a Starfleet officer to understand other cultures, but also a personal pursuit. -- Indeed, personal simplicity has its benefits. Although when I say that I find humans to be complicated, I am also referring to your emotions and culture, which are both complicated to me as an outsider."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:36 AM
Taking an extra fork, she skewered a large piece of the glazed purli bird and set it onto Sa'val's plate. "Are they? I didn't think they were so different from Betazoid ones? T'Pel and I have been able to communicate flawlessly as far as I am concerned."
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:37 AM
Sa'val continued to chew his bite contentedly and set it down. He finished before he took the end of the fork and popped the piece of purli bird into his mouth. He chewed curiously and eventually nodded his approval.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:38 AM
Maleb cleared his throat, looking down at the table for a beat. "Culturally and philosophically, I am a full-blooded Vulcan. I was raised on Vulcan and have little connection to Betazoid culture. As intriguing as their traditions are, they are not my own." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:38 AM
"Oh, I didn't realize, Maleb. I'm sorry."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:38 AM
T'Pel quirked a brow, but said nothing.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:39 AM
Sara made a mental note to not bring up his Betazoid half in the future. If he didn't think it was relevant, then neither did she. (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:40 AM
"It is no issue. I cannot be offended. Regardless, you are not aware of my exact circumstances, and thus would not know that I am fully immersed in Vulcan culture. Do not be concerned."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:41 AM
"I won't bring it up again at any rate. But- now knowing, if you do have any questions, as your resident human friend, I am very happy to answer any questions you have!"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:43 AM
Maleb nodded. "Ah. Thank you. If I may ask a question now -- Is it considered rude to not don a costume on Halloween? I do not see the logic of so-called 'dressing up' but I do not wish to offend the humans on the Phoenix."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:45 AM
"Oh don't worry! No one would take offense. Costumes, customarily, are for children, but sometimes adults like us dress up for fun or parties- it is completely voluntary!"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:46 AM
"In the effort of promoting IDIC and participating in others cultures...I think I may dress up."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:46 AM
"Though, some places that host Halloween parties deign to have 'costume only' themes, but the one on the ship will be very relaxed- I do not like to have strict rules on the way people enjoy theirselves."
"-Though..I also will be dressing up."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 07:48 AM
"That is good to know... What will you both be pretending to be?" Maleb asked, quirking an eyebrow. He had no idea what people usually dressed up as. Like, no idea at all. In the slightest.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:50 AM
"Haha, I've gotten a few fun suggestions from friends, but I am not so sure I feel comfortable showing a lot of skin around co-workers. I am still undecided, but a popular idea is a bee..because..you know..arboretum."
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:50 AM
Sa'val nodded at the logic of the connection, his cheeks were full.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:51 AM
"What about you, T'Pel?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 07:55 AM
Her eyes widened a little as she hadn't really thought about it. "I am unsure. I suppose I will have to think more. What is usually a popular costume as I know what to avoid?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 07:57 AM
"It differs from different parts of the world- but most of our human crew are from the Americas..so a popular costume would likely be a famous musician or entertainment artist of some kind. In Norway we keep it more traditional to ghouls and fae- though some people have..extreme variations of what a ghoul or fae might look like!~" (edited)
L. King 12-Aug-20 07:59 AM
Sa'val considered this depiction as he continued to chew.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:02 AM
"An internet search might be your best bet though."
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:11 AM
"That is the one where you wear a sheet over yourself?" Sa'val took another bite.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:19 AM
"That's very old and terrible, but it's considered a "ghost"- but that is not very accurate to what one truly is. A ghoul is a malicious, undead humanoid who eats the flesh of the living. Not unlike a zombie in looks- but zombie's are brainless, ghouls can think and can plan." (edited)
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:20 AM
"Perhaps a cat. Meow." She said in her monotone.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:21 AM
"That is very cute! Black cats are good luck!"
She gestured to T'Pel's black hair. (edited)
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:21 AM
Sa'val snorted and started coughing. He had been caught off guard by the monotone 'Meow'.
3
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:22 AM
"I thought the superstition was the opposite. It would not have any bearing on dressing as one, however. I tend to agree. I am rather fond of all cats." (edited)
She glanced at Sa'val, "Are you going to live?" She asked with a mild smirk.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:23 AM
"It would not be far off the mark, don't Vulcans have the vestigial ability to purr?"
"Or am I thinking of another race?"
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:24 AM
Sa'val nodded at T'Pel through his coughing. He took a drink of his cherry lemonade.
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:24 AM
T'Pel's eyes widened at the question.
"Sa'val? Do we purr?" She grinned, a mischievous twinkle in her eye.
It was not her intention to poke fun at the question, but more so Sa'val.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:27 AM
Sara also looked to Sa'val, curious to the answer.
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:30 AM
Sa'val shrugged, finally getting the obstruction swallowed. "I have not heard you purr since I have known you, so I would say no."
1
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:31 AM
"Do you, Sa'val?" There was no ulterior motive, just genuine curiosity.
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:32 AM
"I do not recall having purred before. Do you have some context regarding a Vulcan purring?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:33 AM
"Once my roommate came back to our dorm from having visited her friends, and while I hadn't noticed when she'd come in, while she sat meditating before bed she was making a sound..similar? I suppose that is why I assumed all Vulcans did such a thing."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:33 AM
T'Pel lowered her face into her hand a moment, suppressing the urge to laugh, "I am sure if the proper stimuli was applied behind his ear, and if he was full, he would do something akin to purring. However...no. We do not purr. That is a fascinating thought, though."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:34 AM
"What do you think the sound she was making was, then? I could only akin it to purring."
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:35 AM
Sa'val mumbled as he took his next bite. "No one should be applying any stimuli behind my ear..."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:35 AM
"Snoring?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:36 AM
"This makes sense, you did not purr as I thought you might when I scritched your scalp. Sorry for testing a theory on you without your knowledge."
"Maybe! But I had never heard a sound from her like that before, even when I've been up late studying."
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:37 AM
Sa'val turned a slight shade of green as buried his face into his sandwich to take another bite. (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:38 AM
"But I suppose that solves the mystery."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:41 AM
"I suppose there could be some mutation that could make something possible for her, though I have never heard of such a thing. I am far from an authority." The tint of jade on his face was enough and she eased her teasing. She didn't actually want to make him choke.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:42 AM
"At any rate- back to business, a cat would be a very smart look, and an easy one to accomplish."
His flush did not go unnoticed. She skewered another piece of the Purli-bird and settled it onto his plate as an apology offering. Looking back towards T'Pel, she continued to eat, awaiting her response.
"Black sweater, black tights, black flats, ears, and tail. Easy-peasy."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:44 AM
"I have also found Vampires a fascinating concept as well. Dracula...quite appealing. Bella Lugosi I believe?"
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:45 AM
Sa'val took the bait in any case and used the fork to eat the peace offering.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:46 AM
"That's a fun one too! You can make fake fangs pretty easily- or just replicate them I guess."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:47 AM
She raises a brow, picturing what that would even look like, "I shall think about it."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:47 AM
"Moreover, I'm concerned with how I can justify replicating so much candy to the Captain right after ship-wide physicals."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:49 AM
"Make them sugar free?"
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:49 AM
Sa'val muttered, cheek full, with a pointed fork. "Re-warfd for suff-esful comple-shun."
Sa'val winced at T'Pel's suggestion and kept eating.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:49 AM
"Then they're not the same! What's the point of having an indulgent holiday if you can't indulge?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:50 AM
"Limit the amount, then? Just give Sa'val his own truck load."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:50 AM
"Hah!~ I guess that's one way to reward everyone for being fit. Rather like a dentist handing out lollipops after a visit."
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:51 AM
Sa'val smiled very slightly at the characterizarion, but kept himself from snorting to avoid any distasteful display. (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:52 AM
"Are either of you nervous for the upcoming physicals?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:53 AM
"As Maleb would say, Vulcan's do not get nervous."
"However, I do watch what I eat and I swim on a regular basis to stay fit."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:56 AM
"I have been trying to work out regularly, but between my other responsibilities- I've found I haven't had the energy or will power to do much extra."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:56 AM
"You are fairly active. I am sure you will pass." (edited)
L. King 12-Aug-20 08:58 AM
Sa'val looked down at himself. He swallowed his next bite. "I will endeavor to spend a few extra hours in the gym."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 08:58 AM
"Well, it is not only physical. As you know, my sleep schedule is horrifically altered, and I find myself staying up for over 24, sometimes 48 hours at my worst- and finding myself passed out in random places. I must get it fixed before the physicals or they will likely fail me for that portion."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 08:59 AM
"Indeed. Set time limits for yourself. Schedule breaks, and when work needs to be done by. If you require help....ask for it. I usually and not terribly busy. I can come across the hall and assist you."
L. King 12-Aug-20 09:03 AM
Sa'val nodded his agreement. "While Maleb and myself are not within as close of proximity, we are able to assist as well to avoid overwhelming T'Pel. Your belief that you are inconveniencing us is illogical. As is overwhelming yourself with work to the point of interfering with your sleep schedule."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:04 AM
"It's not quite like that, I am just full of so much energy!- Until I'm not. And by the time I realize I'm tired, I'm so far over the limit I pass out. I need to set a better schedule for myself for sure, encourage and reward myself for sticking to goals. But it is very hard to sit in my room when I can think of 12 other things I could be doing that exact moment."
L. King 12-Aug-20 09:06 AM
"Perhaps limiting your sugar intake..." Sa'val smirked as he took another bite, practically finishing his panini.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:06 AM
"But then I'd never see you again?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 09:07 AM
"Do you meditate before bed?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:09 AM
"...I had never thought to do so. Sa'val had offered to teach me mental guarding which had meditative measures, but we have both been so busy we haven't had a chance to touch on that. So as far as pure meditation- no."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 09:10 AM
"It could help unwind you enough to sleep. Instead of just sitting thinking of 12 things to do, meditate. I am sure one of us would be willing to help you."
L. King 12-Aug-20 09:17 AM
Sa'val's eyes widened at the reminder. He nodded at the further suggestion. "With T'Pel's further assistance, it is likely we would find a more efficacious solution to this situation."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:18 AM
"Thank you!~ I'm looking forward to it." (edited)
"Sorry I am not more helpful in return."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 09:28 AM
"There is no need to apologize. There is something the requires attention, and we fix it. It is what we do."
"As friends."
L. King 12-Aug-20 09:42 AM
Sa'val nodded as he wiped his mouth with a napkin...as well as some of the excess cheese that had dribbled onto his shirt. "The value you have for all of us is immeasurable."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 09:42 AM
Maleb listened to the conversation, nodding in agreement. "If you require any assistance with anything at all, we will provide as much as we can."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:43 AM
"Hah, neck pinch me at 8pm every night so I'll actually sleep." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 09:46 AM
Maleb tilted his head. "I do not believe that the doctors and nurses in sickbay would find this to be medically advisable."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:46 AM
"Sorry, it was a joke, Maleb."
She gave a wry smile to her friend before continuing her dinner.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 09:50 AM
"Ah. My apologies. I did not intend to offend you. But T'Pel and Lieutenant Stryker's plan is logically sound, and if you require further assistance, I will do my best to help. As long as it is not harmful to you."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 09:53 AM
"I'd prefer that! But very thankfully, Vulcan mental guarding and meditation are very safe. No brutality, no mind-melds, no blood. From what I understand it is a lot of breathing and focusing on aspects of your day."
L. King 12-Aug-20 09:57 AM
Sa'val snerked, an attempt to contain the laughter.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 09:59 AM
Maleb nodded, glad that Sara had selected such a safe technique and was already understanding much of it. "Indeed. Done traditionally, Vulcan meditation is without any risk at all. Much of it is simply approaching your own thoughts logically while using breathing techniques to center yourself. It is all safe."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:06 AM
"Ah, so 12 thoughts at once...but quietly."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 10:10 AM
"Ah - not exactly. At least, not in theory. Unless that is your goal, of course."
L. King 12-Aug-20 10:12 AM
"I believe that may be the actual problem causing the lack of sleep."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:13 AM
"Maybe a melatonin tea?"
L. King 12-Aug-20 10:15 AM
"An interesting possibility...but you are the expert on the effectiveness of tea, especially on your system."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:15 AM
"Unfortunately I'm not a doctor or a chemist- but I'll see if I can find a good recipe anyway, yeah?"
L. King 12-Aug-20 10:17 AM
"That seems logical to me."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 10:18 AM
"Perhaps you should consult a doctor. To make sure that you do not damage your body."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:19 AM
"Ugh, that's what I'm trying to avoid Maleb. I don't like doctors! Not, not as people, they're lovely people but I don't like medbay."
L. King 12-Aug-20 10:21 AM
"Newton appears to be the type who is willing to make house calls...or at least arboretum calls."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 10:22 AM
"Newton is a wise choice. Avoiding doctors while trying new supplements is not only dangerous, but illogical as well." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:23 AM
"Melatonin is a naturally occurring chemical in humans. Taken in small doses, it helps with sleep aid."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 10:28 AM
"Remain safe, Sara. If it means speaking to Newton, please speak to Newton, even if in his off hours. It is not worth the risk of hurting yourself." Maleb's voice was laced with a touch of protectiveness, subtle but fierce.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:30 AM
She desperately wanted to sigh. It would not be the first time she'd ever taken melatonin..but if it would please him- or at least make him 'feel' better.. She would consult with the peach pie. "You're right Sa'val, he really does take to a command position incredibly well~" She gave Maleb a bright smile, her notable sibling-like affection towards him was an odd mix of genuine care and exasperation that bubbled into the white noise that surrounded them all. (edited)
6
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 10:43 AM
Maleb sort of feel it... Kind of? He thought he might have gotten a pulse of caring frustration... Or was it frustrated caring? It was so loud, the static pressing in on his nerves like an innocent bug caught under a shoe. But he did see Sara's smile, which he responded to with an expression of kind eyes and slightly raised brows. "Team members care for team members, ael'kei-miren."
L. King 12-Aug-20 10:44 AM
Sa'val nodded sagely.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 10:53 AM
"And friends care about friends, lite sitron." Okay, so she said she wouldn't call him Lemon anymore, but does it count if it's another language?
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:03 PM
Maleb raised an eyebrow. "Lite sitron?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:16 PM
Sara leaned forward with a smile, hiding her mouth partially with her hand as if what she were saying was a secret. "Little Lemon."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:20 PM
Maleb didn't seem bothered in the slightest. "Just not in front of Commander Dunamis -- or in the groupchat where the Captain is apparently present and active?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:28 PM
"Promise!"
Sara nodded enthusiastically, pleased she got to finally give him his own nickname that he semi-approved of.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:30 PM
Maleb tilted his head with a slight shrug. "I suppose it is no issue, then. What what language is lite sitron?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:33 PM
"Norse, of course? But I know there is no word for lemon in Vulcan, but a word for a sour, sweet taste is "Sfith." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:42 PM
"Ah. Logical. Indeed, Vulcan does not have many words for the plants and fruit of other cultures, aside from loanwords. Sfith is reserved exclusively for actual flavors. It is actually rather rare in Vulcan cuisine, so it is not a common word, though still heard enough to be considered somewhat basic vocabulary. Much like 'umami' in Standard."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:45 PM
"I only learned 'Sfith' a few months ago when I'd made a lemon pie for a Vulcan friend who's transferred now. He seemed a bit startled..or as startled as a Vulcan can look I suppose, and exclaimed that." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:46 PM
"Ah- just to clarify, she used Sfith on its own, not as a prefix, correct?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:47 PM
"He, but yes."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:50 PM
"Right, he. When used as a prefix, sfith means unpleasantly sour, as there is no need to make the flavor of something part of how you refer to it unless it is highly relevant, such as disgusting or dangerous. On its own, however, it can refer to the sourness alone."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:51 PM
"Oh! I did not know that, I thought for a while it just meant lemon-flavor."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:54 PM
"Many words change meaning slightly in different contexts. It helps to keep the most integral vocabulary somewhat small and keep words from being too niche. Vulcan is a very logical language."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 05:55 PM
"Oh trust, my vocabulary is very small. Speaking it plainly- I might be on par with a very young child, haha! But it does not seemed to have helped keeping my vocab small." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 05:58 PM
"Ah. If you ever wish to practice, I am fluent in Vulcan. Although communicating in Standard is sometimes difficult with my universal translator off -- I tend to ramble and utilize overly complex phrasing due to having learned it from old Earth texts as a small child. But I can do my best to assist you." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:01 PM
"Th'i-oxalra! Or I guess, to be appreciative of a certain thing, Itar-bosh?"
"Is that right?"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:08 PM
"Yes. That is more Vulcan than most humans ever speak on its own. Very impressive, Sara." Maleb said, nodding with approval. Deities, hearing a human speak Vulcan was so strange but so fascinating!
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:11 PM
"I seem to have an affinity for making friends with Vulcans- and picking up words from them~"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:15 PM
"Ah. Another word that I believe may benefit you is k'war'ma'khon -- a word for someone who is as close as family but not biologically so. I believe you will find use for it frequently aboard the Phoenix."
L. King 12-Aug-20 06:16 PM
"You have an affinity for making friends of all types, Sara. There just happens to be an influx of Vulcans." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:17 PM
She thought about it for a moment, taking a moment to blink. "I think.. you over estimate how many truly close friends I have, Maleb. I am friendly with everyone of course! I have friends aboard, very good ones. But none of them annoy me and endear me like a sibling would quite like you do." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:24 PM
Oh. Winds. Ah. Don't cry, Maleb, just respond. Don't cry. Vulcans don't cry. "Ah. I did not realize this. I am gl- It is agreeable to know that you consider me that close to you. Ah- I have no true family. At least, no one that satisfies both aspects of being 'blood related' and worthy of being called family. But you three -- and the rest of the crew -- are the closest I have had to family in a very long time. I- I suppose it would be appropriate to say thank you." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:30 PM
"I don't mind that we're not blood. There is very old human saying that says "The blood of the covenant is stronger than the water of the womb." Meaning that the family we choose will always sate you deeper than the family you are born into." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:34 PM
"When one's blood family does not satisfy, indeed, the family that one chooses is much more meaningful." Maleb said, minding his phrasing to avoid the guilt of accidentally implying negative things about his parents. "I would choose all of you over my grandparents without any qualms. Again, thank you."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:36 PM
"You're very welcome! But it is the truth. And not to sound TOO much like you, but thanking someone for simply saying truth is not very logical."
Despite the teasing, she grinned at him once more before delving back into her dinner.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:38 PM
"Perhaps you are correct -- or perhaps it is a matter of judgement. Regardless, your concerns of logic are most interesting -- it is rare to hear a human speak of Vulcan ideals. I suppose it is related to our earlier topic of sharing cultures."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:42 PM
"Contrary to popular belief, humans are not wild humanoids running off adrenaline and animal insticts. We have logic, maybe not in such great abundance as Vulcans, but we have our moments~ It's no hardship to incorporate a vulcan ideal into every day life in much the way it is not so hard for you to eat an earth melon instead of a kava fruit for breakfast."
"Thinking of your actions and the consequences thereof, what outcomes you want by doing what action, setting the tone of your day by entering the mindset that you want. That is what I imagine Vulcan logic to be." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:45 PM
"Oh, I have no doubt that humans can be very logical, and you have summarized our definition of logic very well. But it is not often that a human speaks about it in the same terms and manner that a Vulcan would. It is quite fascinating. Although I do not believe that I have had an 'Earth melon.'"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:47 PM
"We can change that! Maybe after the aquarium we can go to a fruiteria?"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 12-Aug-20 06:49 PM
"That would be most intriguing, assuming that it is not an issue for all of you. I do not wish to disturb your plans." Maleb said as he finished his meal. "If you all are finished, we can go to the aquarium now."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 12-Aug-20 06:51 PM
T'Pel looked around the table, unlacing her fingers from the delicate tent they had made. Content with how much she had consumed. Ready to head out and already looking for a path
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 12-Aug-20 06:52 PM

Checking to make sure Sara was not falling behind as she was usually painfully aware that she would have left them both in the dust had she not been diligent.

Lieutenant Oskar König 13-Aug-20 10:48 PM
Lincoln walked through the crowd in the promenade, a sea bag around his shoulders. Gods, there were more people here then he remembered. After orienteering himself on the right path, he began walking to where the Phoenix was docked. He had heard stories about the ship on the Parris Island. Some said cursed. Others said lucky. But he would have to determine which of the two he believed. After walking for a few more minutes, he had found the airlock for the Phoenix. He stared into the hall that awaited him. "Yeah, it is an interesting place to work. I love all the people that work they are all so nice and good co-workers though I am a little biased. I am there Assistant Chief."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Aug-20 06:26 PM
Deimora chuckled, "Engineering sounds fun, though I will add my own biased opinion, Tactical has the best stories."
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 25-Aug-20 06:29 PM
"I don't know about that, I got some pretty interesting stories." Malcolm said with a sly smirk. Story off see who could tell the best story about their crazy adventures.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Aug-20 06:34 PM
"Three days ago I took down a Scorpion with one shot to the engine." She raised an eyebrow.
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 25-Aug-20 06:38 PM
"You, ever been on a spacewalk in the middle of a space battle. You can really see the destructive power of plasma torpedo." Malcolm said as his gaze turned to look out the window again.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Aug-20 06:39 PM
"Y'ever stabbed a Borg in the head?" Deimora chuckled, bringing her attention back to the window.
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 25-Aug-20 06:41 PM
"You ever save the President of the Federations life from section 31 agents?" Malcolm said with a smirk. (edited)
8
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Aug-20 06:44 PM
"You ever unplug a Genesis Egg and rescue a Q?" Deimora's smile only widened.
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 25-Aug-20 06:56 PM
"No I can't say I have saved a being with unlimited power from an egg but, that wouldn't have been possible without engineerings EMP to get you over to the ship. I have done many things that are classified which I can't tell you about though. What I can say is that you'll find every department has their epic stories to tell. Well, what are your plans for shore leave, if we get some?" (edited)
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Aug-20 06:57 PM
"I thought of seeing my dads, they moved upstate full time. But I'm not sure. I think my cousin's ship is docking some point soon." She shrugged.

Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Aug-20 07:04 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 07:35 PM
He found himself wandering the promenade aimlessly sometime later - he needed to buy ingredients for dinner and this was among the best places to find what he needed.
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 07:37 PM
T'Svai found herself pretending to be exceedingly interested in the promenade directory.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 07:42 PM
Looking over her shoulder was quite easy being six feet and eight inches of lanky muscle. There was a grocery shop about two decks down - perfect. He had a list of things to buy in mind already...
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 07:45 PM
She turned when she saw the Commander. Kelpiens were quite distinctive, after all. Hard to miss. "Commander. Save for our brief conversation in holodeck two during the training session I do not believe we have formally met. Now seems to be an ideal time to rectify that." She said a little more quickly than she would ordinarily speak.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 07:52 PM
"I'd be open to that suggestion." He replied, letting out a long, wearied sigh. "What would you like to talk about...?"
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 07:55 PM
She raised an eyebrow. "Perhaps whatever is causing you distress, though if that is too heavy a topic I am willing to settle for a conversation about... whatever that is." The latter suggestion was mostly improvisation. She pointed at something near one of the sellers that looked like a venus flytrap, but was currently singing Kasseelian Opera using several of its heads for no discernable reason.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 07:58 PM
"Whatever is causing me distress." Oh, boy. The topic was hard for him, predictably - she could see his expression harden instantly as he looked away from the shop directory. "Some part of it, then - I am not quite comfortable with talking about the topic in entirety for now. Shall we converse as we walk?"
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 08:01 PM
"I do not wish to cause you further discomfort nor invade your privacy, sir." She said carefully, then nodded. "Walking seems appropriate. I have no destination in mind, illogical as that is."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 08:03 PM
"I will be heading to the supermarket two decks down - I do like to cook my own dinner at times." He loped off down the hallway, pausing to let her follow at his side.
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 08:06 PM
She looked down at her PADD for a moment, then up. "Perhaps that is appropriate. Replicators can only mimic such items with so much definition." She commented. "I believe I may cook later as well." She decided in the moment. Yes. That would be a nice gesture.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 08:07 PM
"Well, three years working in a bistro teaches one a few things, especially one as busy and varied as my aunt's." He remarked. "She loved serving people and talking to them, sometimes easing their troubles - woe betide her kitchen staff, however, who had to cook for them all at breakneck speed."
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 08:09 PM
"I cannot say I am overly familiar with Kelpien cuisine." She noted. "What does it consist of?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 08:12 PM
"Mostly what we grow and catch in the local waters. I know of a pastry that you might like, made from ground-up Fredalia flower petals." He said, stopping at the turbolift and hitting the call panel.
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 08:18 PM
Fredalia... yes, Sorik had some of that in his greenhouse as part of an attempt to make a strain hardy enough to grow on spaceships. She recalled its appearance, though couldn't remember having smelled or tasted one in any form. "Perhaps so. It is possible you would enjoy saffir." She suggested. "Though there are some distinct dissimilarities given how Vulcan physiology responds to sugar."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 08:21 PM
"I can make you a sugarless version if you'd like to try some." He offered, "As for the saffir - perhaps."
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 08:33 PM
"Given that I will be taking advantage of the time I'm off-duty in the near future, the authentic version is appropriate." She suggested, a slight glimmer in her eye. She briefly recalled the Vulcan port debacle on the K'Warko. Good times. "Say- It just occurred to me. Is there a kitchen in spacedock, on the civilian decks perhaps, or would I have to invite someone onto the ship if I planned to cook for them?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 25-Aug-20 08:36 PM
"I believe it depends." He mused as he stepped into the turbolift. "I used to keep kitchen equipment in my quarters until the recent battle, when it was all lost along with my bed and several of my belongings. There are also restaurants on deck nineteen; perhaps you might like to try using their equipment with permission. As to anywhere else, I am currently unsure."
Commander T'Svai 25-Aug-20 10:21 PM
She nodded sympathetically. "That is unfortunate. My belongings had much the same fate." She paused. "Perhaps taking someone aboard would be unwise. It would be more alarming than reassuring, unless the repairs are by some miracle already complete."

Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 05:09 PM
[D] Following the battle and all, Ops had had a lot of job along with engineering. Now, well, the Betazoid was taking some (well deserved?) off-time. She seemed content to let her mind wander as she sat on a bench. Over there, someone was worried... and, seconds later, a huge spike of happiness. Again. Yep. There had been several of those. Family and friends meeting their loved ones that were coming back in one piece. Aside from that, there was also the general happiness of being on shore leave floating around. All in all, it felt good. Much, much better than these days on the ship with everyone on edge and scared and hurt- Nope. This was really good.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 05:13 PM
And then there was another more familiar spike of worry, somewhat more relaxed now, but still there. The Kelpien came walking down the hallway laden with shopping bags - bacon, apples, lemons, was that a carton of mango juice and a packet of flour? He seemed to be chewing on a chocolate bar too, humming contentedly as he roamed the promenade. Ooh, an antique copy of Sun Tzu's Art of War. He might just pick that up...
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 05:26 PM
Eyelids opened slowly, black orbs now scanning the crowd. It didn't take long to spot the tall, tall guy. Yep, she knew she recognized all that worry, though it did bring her a little smile to discern that it was more relaxed now. Oh, chocolate. Was that the answer to worry?, she joked to herself. Jennei got up, walking towards the Kelpien. She wasn't as easy to spot in a crowd with her little 4'9" though, but she wasn't the type to walk close to walls and make herself small either. She already was, she didn't need to emphasize it. She arrived by one side, with a cheerful. "Hello-Hello, Commander~! I'm happy to see you're more relaxed than last time! This shore leave's doing you some good, or it's the chocolate?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 05:31 PM
"Ensign Akvaa." He smiled wearily, swallowing the last stub of chocolate in his mouth and reaching for the next bar in his shopping bag. The Betazoid looked just as chipper as last time - which was good! The ship needed people like her. "I suppose the cause might be both. Or perhaps the adequate amount of wonderful sleep that I've been getting over the past few days. I have never slept better or longer in my tenure aboard Phoenix."
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 05:45 PM
"Well, that's fantastic to hear! I can't say I've caught up yet on my sleep, Ops was pretty busy on the way there, so I'm still catching up on that... but I know how a good sleep can do miracles on the mind! Probably all those three things are making a wonderful 'getting better' combo." Then, she looked over his shopping bags more carefully, trying to get what he might cook with that. "Planning some cooking?" she asked, with a smile. She was far from a cook, but she did enjoy food and talking about such, and was therefore truly curious. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 05:52 PM
"Cooking, yes. As soon as my quarters and the equipment I kept in it are restored. Perhaps something simple for a start: my partner taught be a recipe for good oyakodon from Japan. Simple, but delicious." He paused in front of another shop window to examine the red and blue striped shirt in the display window. "How about you? Have you any plans for shore leave?"
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 06:01 PM
"Mmmh, I'm not well-versed in Earth's food culture, but the name sounds good, might look later what this looks like." A pause, thinking. Jennei didn't seem that interested in displays, for now. "Weeeeell... I don't think I'll visit Betazed this shore leave, but who knows. Might wander around here or on Earth... Honestly? I haven't planned a single thing yet- except sleeping." she said with a little grin.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 06:05 PM
“Except sleep? I do think you and the Operations crew need it. Deserve it rather - you do so much of the good work that we take for granted. But if you want somewhere to visit I’ve extended an invitation to any crew who would like to visit Kaminar with me. I’ll be returning home to visit my father, aunt and uncle in a few days’ time.” He offered, “There are some scenic places to visit planetside. Our tourism industry performs quite well.”
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 06:20 PM
"Thanks, it does some good to hear it, sometimes," she said, her smile turning softer. Yep, it always did good to hear someone said it directly, even if you knew you did some good. If you didn't, people would be complaining, and no one was, but directly? Yeah. "Oh, hadn't read really anything coming on my PADD unless it was written 'Urgent' since I've been on leave, must have missed it... I'll think about it, though! Don't want to hastily accept, but it is quite a charming idea... if you're sure you don't mind an obnoxious Betazoid on your trip, that is." she joked with a grin. She did appreciate the offer though, and might just accept. It would probably be better than staying alone wandering here, the 'probably' being a tad sarcastic. She was a 'people person', after all.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 06:29 PM
“I do not mind at all, actually! The company is always appreciated. We leave in two days if you’d like to come. Dress warm - Kaminar’s winters are quite cold. My aunt’s home has enough spare guest rooms, I do believe. As long as you don’t mind the eleven or so extra Kelpien children that may come to visit.” Eleven cousins and their parents, he declined to mention. Giant Kelpien families were a problem sometimes, the children raucous, loud and playful - but that was the same of any other species, mostly, no?
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 06:52 PM
"Alright, I'll be sure to remember so~!" Oof, that was a lot of children... It'd do though, there were spots to visit and other places to be, so she wouldn't be all the time around those little mental maelstroms all the time. And even then, children were mostly joyful, right? So, not too much trouble. Hopefully. "And it's no problem, if I can deal with exploding consoles, I can deal with children." A link? None whatsoever. Well, both were a bit of trouble and at the same time some fun- Not that she liked ships in bad shape, but it was good sometimes to just be you, that fried console and a couple of new wires and so to get it back in shape. Anyway, both were making weird sounds, doing things you not always understood but would end up understanding them in the end, both were things you didn't always want to deal with but had to... huh, was she really comparing those two things right now? Maybe she did need more sleep, but that'd be later.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 06:57 PM
“That’s a rather funny analogy - but I suppose it works.” Chuckling he set off slowly down the hallway. “I wonder occasionally how I remember them all by name and their personal preferences. I buy them presents every year. To them their uncle Dunamis brings them something every time he comes home and I don’t intend to disappoint this time!”
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 07:05 PM
"That's impressive! Sometimes, I don't even remember what I ate for breakfast- and don't even start me on deck numbers!" she said, chuckling too as she followed. It was good he was going slowly or else she might not be able to follow with her short legs. "You seem like an awesome uncle, I'm sure you won't- though, I guess children can be quite picky when they want to. Not all of them, but... I kinda was, most of the time." she finished with a little smile.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 07:07 PM
“Which one of us wasn’t picky as a child, miss Akvaa? Even I was. We all had that little rebellious spark in us in our youth didn’t we...?” Tempered by age and reforged, perhaps, into the sense of independence one carried as an adult. “I recall when I would not eat broccoli at dinner when I was a young child...”
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 07:18 PM
"Oh, I had this... cousin, not really a cousin but I can never remember how he was somehow related to me and that's not really the important part, but anyway, I swear that everything you'd put in front of him, it would disappear in a matter of seconds. The thing was that sometimes, non-food was passing too, so a bit of a problem." she chuckled. "Yeah, we did... And broccoli? Ah! My thing was more like, if I recall that it was like for a month or so, that I decided that green, purple and blue were good colors and that everything else was not good to eat, if they weren't one of those colors. Kinda a pain in the ass to my parents to make me eat healthily." she grinned.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 07:24 PM
“How amusing! We were all quite something in our distant youth weren’t we? Once in every two blue moons I’d love to revisit those times again. My martial arts classes at night with ensign Leichner. Studying sciences and engineering with my parents in the afternoon after their shifts. Not quite getting on with the other noticeably more humanoid children. Good times we can never have again.” He sighed wearily, suppressing a yawn. “Well, I shall be heading back to the ship and the cargo bay for some rest, then. And possibly to find somrwhere to keep all this food. Meet me at the shuttle bay here on Spacedock in two days, at 1500 hours if you’d like to join me.” (edited)
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 07:40 PM
"Yeah, that's right..." Never again. Yep. She had moved on from both her parents' death, but it didn't mean it wasn't a difficult thing to think about, sometimes, so she preferred to think about the last part he said. The future, who held many good possibilities, along with bad ones, but focusing on the good ones right now was good enough. "Alright, rest well, Commander! I'll be sure to remember that, in the case I decide to do so!" Highly possible case, but she didn't need to mention it. He'd see. She'd see, too.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Aug-20 07:41 PM
“The same to you - rest well. Don’t overwork yourself, yes?” He sent a brief wave her way and loped through the airlock.
Ensign Jennei Akvaa 26-Aug-20 07:45 PM
"I'll try to~!" she lastly shouted with a wave as he left, then she walked back to her bench. A bit more of mind wandering, then maybe she'd go to sleep.
Commander T'Svai 26-Aug-20 08:05 PM
As she left, she turned a corner and almost walked directly into Kuslaya. The other Vulcan, in the kind of semi-formal dress common to those in academia, turned to her and held up a ta'al. [Kuslaya] "Peace and long life, k'diwa." There was a certain emphasis on the long life part and a faint note of humor in their words, though likely undetectable to a non-Vulcan. They then held out two fingers for an ozh'esta. [T'Svai] T'Svai let out a breath and pressed two fingers to Kuslaya's, completing the gesture. "Live long and prosper, ashayam. Was the formal greeting truly necessary?" [Kuslaya] "It was appropriate, given the circumstances of our meeting here." They let their hands fall to their sides. [T'Svai] T'Svai did the same, then clasped her hands behind her back, which was very awkward while holding a bag. "And yet I stand before you, alive and well. You should not have come. You have told me that your laboratory assistants occasionally lack precision in their measuring. Think of your project." (edited)
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 26-Aug-20 08:17 PM
[Kuslaya] They nodded. "Yes my assistants have made those mistakes. However I have disciplined them and they have my trust in working without my presence. Besides, I wanted to see you."
Commander T'Svai 26-Aug-20 08:25 PM
T'Svai nodded softly. "I have faith in your judgement. However, I am considering returning to Vulcan for shore leave. I have submitted a request to the Captain. I therefore regret the time you devoted to traveling here to start with, though while we are here, is there anything you would like to see?"
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 26-Aug-20 09:22 PM
“It is not a problem that I traveled here, I wanted to waste no time to see you. If your request is approved we can travel back to Vulcan together. As for something to do while we are here. They looked around the promenade for something to do before their eyes landed on the aquarium. “Would you like to join me at the aquarium?”
