Sara got to the door first and opened it wide to allow everyone to walk inside.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 10:39 PM
Deimora stepped inside, uttering a thank you as she passed. (edited)
L. King 26-Aug-20 10:40 PM
Sa'val shook his head, not convinced. "I do not know. I have an unfortunate premonition. Clearly I am not qualified for a promotion."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 26-Aug-20 10:40 PM
"What makes you say such a thing?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 10:40 PM
T'Pel followed, "Logically...a promotion would make sense."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 10:41 PM
"Sa'val, you're so much more qualified than you think." Deimora responded.
L. King 26-Aug-20 10:41 PM
Sa'val gestured to himself as if it was obvious why he wasn't going to get promoted. He then appraised Sara with a smirk. He placed his hand on the door, over her head and gestured for her to proceed him. Maleb, obviously deciding it would he illogical to wait for this stalemate to continue, preceeded them both. (edited)
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 10:42 PM
"Deimora is correct, Sa'val."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 26-Aug-20 10:43 PM
"You know, I am allowed to do nice things for you too, Val." She huffed playfully, her job being near forcefully taken from her as door opener. Quickly knocking her hand into his before stepping inside, she gave another smile. "T'Pel and I try frequently, but getting him to admit his own great self worth is like pulling teeth."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 10:44 PM
"Despite recent events...I do have patience. We will convince him eventually."
L. King 26-Aug-20 10:46 PM
Sa'val held the door for a pair of Andorians before following Sara. "I am an adequate Marksman, if that helps." Sa'val smirked at Deimora, who could appreciate that.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 10:46 PM
"You're more than adequate in my book Sav." Deimora laughed.
Commander T'Svai 26-Aug-20 10:47 PM
She nodded and had she been human, she would have smiled. Being Vulcan, she did not. "That is a sound plan."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 10:48 PM
"Modesty is illogical." She smirked. "There is no shame in acknowledging your successes." (edited)
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 10:51 PM
"Truly, I agree with T'Pel," Deimora lightly clapped a hand on Sa'val's shoulder as a friendly gesture.
L. King 26-Aug-20 10:54 PM
"See? I can accept the fact that I am an accomplished Marksman. Would they be sufficent?" Sa'val gestured to Deimora looked at Sara and T'Pel and Sara with a triumphant smirk. "Vanity is equally as illogical." Sa'val continued to smirk at the two and would have almost stuck his tongue out had he not been in public. "Now, what would you suggest we order?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 10:56 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 26-Aug-20 10:58 PM
"There's no winning, you just have to let it be said and hope he knows you mean it."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 11:00 PM
"I'm going to have Vegitarian ramen, I think with a Soy base," Deimora smiled, her order ingrained in her memory.
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 11:04 PM
"And Sa'val...you are so detached from the very notion of vanity. It would be like trying to blend oil and water." T'Pel said, clasping her hands in her lap. The smallest sensation crawling up the back of her neck, but she was doing her best to ignore it.
L. King 26-Aug-20 11:05 PM

𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 11:15 PM

Deimora turned to the new voice. Blond, fair, a Bjørge.

A large, blonde man had stepped over to the table, giving them a polite nod of his head, hands clasped behind his back as he regarded his sisters' friend group.

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 26-Aug-20 11:27 PM
*Her face was nearly as red as the cherry-colored tabletop. It wasn't as if Sebastian were being embarrassing, but he was so formal.* (edited)
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 11:27 PM
"You're a weapons expert, so I hear from Sa'val." Deimora turned to Sebastan with a slight smile.

I am sure Deadeye here would be able to attest to the fact that we certainly could have used you skill with some of the Tal Shiar weaponry we faced, sir." Sa'val gestured to Deimora.
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 11:28 PM

Commander Sebastian Bjørge BOT 26-Aug-20 11:30 PM
"So I've heard. Unfortunately, The Tortuga was too far off to be of any use in that particular battle, but from what I hear, and the general consensus, the Phoenix was instrumental in winning it. My dearest congratulations to all of you, I hope it was an exciting learning experience, yes?"
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 26-Aug-20 11:31 PM

"Ah, apologies, seeing as you are the third and final Vulcan, may I assume you are Maleb?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 11:33 PM
Deimora broke with a slight grimace, she already wished she'd done better, this was a little much. She wiped the expression off of her face and returned to the conversation. "A learning experience yes, exciting, sure."
L. King 26-Aug-20 11:34 PM
"Your knowledge certainly would have...limited our casualties...even if Deadeye managed to handle the actual turning of the tide of the battle and personally delivering the means to...hand us the victory."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 26-Aug-20 11:34 PM

Commander Sebastian Bjørge BOT 26-Aug-20 11:37 PM
Looking to Deimora's grimace, he raised a slight of a blonde eyebrow and shook his head. "There's little reason to be ashamed of this victory, Ms. Byrne. In this line of work- it is a truly, dearly unfortunate reality that we face. We all do our part to ensure that everyone goes back to quarters at the end of the day- but..we cannot account for every surprise, every trick up their sleeve, and every ace they have in the hole. All we can do..is adapt better for next time so that everyone goes home with us."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 11:39 PM
"Of course, we can't know everything before hand, but maybe I could've done more. Being driven is simply what we do." Deimora shrugged, "It's over now anyways, nothing we can change."
Commander Sebastian Bjørge BOT 26-Aug-20 11:39 PM
"It doesn't make it feel any better, victory or loss knowing that someone we knew, or even possibly didn't, doesn't get to partake in the success. But in that devastation, in that loss of life, we should cement it towards planning deeper, moving faster, and being stronger and smarter."
"Fate is in the hands of the Allfather- we can only do what we know, Ms. Byrne. And no one will fault you for not being all-knowing."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 11:42 PM
Deimora found the mention of Odin rather comforting, a reminder of home. She rolled up her sleeves out of necesity, revealing close to a dozen tattoos of runes, and that was just her forearms.
L. King 26-Aug-20 11:43 PM
Sa'val considered these points significantly, his brows furrowed slightly. His countenance changed to a less pensive facade at the support the older man offered to Deimora. "Perhaps you would be free to join us for lunch, Commander Bjørge?" (edited)
Commander Sebastian Bjørge BOT 26-Aug-20 11:47 PM

Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 26-Aug-20 11:49 PM

Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Aug-20 11:49 PM

Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 26-Aug-20 11:54 PM

Commander Sebastian Bjørge BOT 26-Aug-20 11:57 PM

Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 26-Aug-20 11:58 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 27-Aug-20 12:00 AM
Sara's eyes were nearly bugging out of her head.

Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 12:44 AM
"Norse runes, I'm not particularly supersticious but they're mostly luck and protection symbols. My aunt was absolutely covered in them from head to toe. Now I'm honestly pretty glad I got them, considering what happened."

Commander Sebastian Bjørge BOT 27-Aug-20 12:48 AM

L. King 27-Aug-20 01:13 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 27-Aug-20 01:15 AM

Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 01:15 AM
Deimora was the last to leave, she’d figure out something to do.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 01:56 AM
Deimora figured they'd be coming out with promotions so she waited on a bench for them to finish.

T'Pel sat with her.

"Did you adjust well at all to the cargo bay?" Deimora sparked conversation.

Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 03:54 AM
"It was alright, to put it simply, I don't enjoy loud and crowded spaces. They make me feel panicked and choked." (edited)
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 27-Aug-20 03:59 AM
"If I do not prepare myself....I feel the same. It gets difficult to even hear myself think."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 03:59 AM
"Ah, I understand, feeling like I'm drowning or suffocating makes me overload. I did grow up in a cramped city but I always got breaks, and headphones on the train."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 27-Aug-20 04:06 AM
"I have meditation among other ways to block out the noise."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 04:07 AM
"Unfortunately my headphones were sucked into space but the ship is being repaired so I'll be in my quarters soon once again."
//go for it!
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 27-Aug-20 04:12 AM
Walking over, both Vulcans in tow, she waved wildly at the two other women. "You guys were right!~"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Aug-20 04:14 AM
"I'm so happy for you!" Deimora jogged over rather enthusiastically and congratulated the group before wrapping Sa'val in a hug, a slightly tight one, but similar to the one he'd given her in the hallway.

Maleb followed behind, saying nothing as he let the others do the talking. Well, almost nothing. It would have be rude to not say a quick, "Greetings."
𝕿'𝕻𝖊𝖑 𝕶𝖊𝖘𝖙𝖗𝖆 27-Aug-20 04:18 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Aug-20 07:55 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 27-Aug-20 07:56 AM
Sara licked her ice cream, looking on with interest at the happenings before her.
"So mister Kalen, if you're not starfleet, is it alright to ask what you do?"
Kalen BOT 27-Aug-20 08:00 AM
"You could say I am a jack of all trades, as long as I am traveling. Transports, cargo, some mining. Depends on what i find. Once I am bored, I move on. When I heard of the Phoenix though...I quit and headed home as soon as I could."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Aug-20 08:04 AM
"Judging by the previous part of your statement I'm guessing that something aboard Phoenix is of interest to you. Aside from the obvious of course?"
Kalen BOT 27-Aug-20 08:08 AM
He gave Dune a wink, as he took another bite, "I meant about what happened. News traveled fast and thankfully I wasn't far. Shortly after getting to Vulcan, however...I headed here to wait for you to dock. I saw the damage from the shuttle here." He said with a wince, "We will hope mother never sees pictures."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Aug-20 08:12 AM
"Worry not. I do like to tell my crew that Phoenix's crew and their spirit are stubborn flames. We shall not be extinguished quite so easily. You can be assured of that. Neither your sister nor those she calls dear."
Kalen BOT 27-Aug-20 08:14 AM
"After meeting you all today, I have no doubt that you will all put up one hell of a fight until your dying breath. It's....quite inspiring." He smirked.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Aug-20 08:19 AM
"I am pleased that you view us that way. We are grateful for it."
Kalen BOT 27-Aug-20 08:21 AM
"I am far from the only one. The fact you all think so highly of each other, piled on to the fact you won't find a contrary opinion on this station...It is pretty impressive."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Aug-20 08:25 AM
"I'm sure it is." He remarked, tossing his empty milkshake cup in the bin nearby. "Well. I shall be off, then - I promise to stay in touch."
Kalen BOT 27-Aug-20 08:29 AM
"As do I, my dear Commander."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 27-Aug-20 08:32 AM

[Image attached: exosuit, interior view of faceplate facing outwards, with a heads up display focused on a very serious looking T'Khus, holding up a ta'al, her face circled on the display. Gnik Trac Gnippohs Eht 06-Nov-20 04:11 PM
[D] Dressed in civilian clothes, which for Krurin is a simple pair of khaki cargo pants and a white tank top, she made her way through the promenade in search of something special that she could maybe surprise S'Tera with. Now that they were roommates, the two Caitians could personalize their room however they wanted. So Krurin wanted to see what she could find to liven the place up and make S'Tera happy. She wasn’t sure where to start as she hadn’t been down to the ESD in a long time. So it was slightly obvious that she was unsure of where to start as she wandered the promenade in circles to find where exactly it was she wanted to go.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 04:16 PM
As Dune passed her, he simply sent a smile and wave her way. Krurin was her name, wasn't it? One of the security crew? He recalled reading about her while perusing the security department's files once.
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 04:25 PM
[Krurin] Krurin barely even noticed the commanding officer's smile and wave, the height of the Kelpien put her more looking at a moving lower torso as opposed to anything else. Had he maybe said something, she might have looked up but instead she looked around for some sort of 'gift store'.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 04:28 PM
As it turned out, he paused outside a small gift shop and peered inside, staring at a model of a ship in a bottle. Something to add to the ready room, maybe. Or not. Regardless he stepped inside, quietly humming to himself. (edited)
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 05:16 PM
[Krurin] Finally spotting a gift shop with lots of little trinkets and bobbles, Krurin decided to enter, her tail swished with each bounce of her step as she walked through the doorway and started to look around for something S'Tera would like.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 05:20 PM
Well, as it turned out Dune happened to be in the next aisle over as he browsed through the shop's selection of items - so many things would look nice in his ready room or quarters, he thought. However, also, as it turned out, carrying a bag full to bursting (almost) with groceries and apples balanced precariously on top is not a good idea. As he leaned over, some of them fell out of his bag, scattering all over the floor.
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 05:24 PM
[Krurin] Apples trickling their way down Dune's aisle and spilling into Krurin's, she flet a few small bumps on her feet. She looked down and noticed the apples rolling away from whoever their owner was. Obviously someone had lost them, she hadn't noticed an apple display in the store. Wanting to be polite, she bent down and started picking them up.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 05:35 PM
Goodness gracious. Well, there was no time to grumble about it - nor was there any use in doing so. He simply bent down and picked them up and, having noticed some missing, took a look around... and saw Krurin holding the rest in the next aisle over. Thank goodness. "Ah, lieutenant. Sorry to bother you. Can I have those, please? I should have been more careful..." (edited)
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 05:42 PM
[Krurin] "It's not a bother," she looked up at the Kelpien with bright golden eyes. There was only one Kelpien she knew from The Phoenix who had those striking eyes. This was the commander who was awkwardly trying to pick up the remainder of his apples. "Oh! Commander," Krurin nodded, had she not been holding a good stack of apples she might have saluted. "It's not really your fault, someone decided that apples should be round and I personally find it to be a design flaw." She gave a gruff laugh before standing up and bringing the apples to him. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 05:54 PM
"Ah, the wonderful strangeness of evolution. Sometimes one wonders why it does the things it does." He noted with a dry laugh. Really, though, evolution did do some ridiculous things sometimes. Up til now he still wondered what had driven the powers that be to give him hooves for feet. "How might you have improved them?"
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 06:02 PM
[Krurin] "Triangular structures don't roll, I think that triangular fruits and vegetables would be ideal." She stretched with a yawn, "I think that it would be pretty hard to have those processes happen naturally though." Krurin thought about what other things in nature were triangular and thought of mountains, "Well, hard for plants." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 06:04 PM
"Triangular fruit. Now that would be interesting to see!" Triangular watermelons. Ha ha. Now that'd be a sight. After taking the apples back from her he stuffed the lot back into his shopping bag and straightened up, towering over her like a golem - a very tall, lanky, almost emaciated golden-eyed golem.
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 06:16 PM
[Krurin] Krurin craned her head back to meet his eyes. His head was a long way up. She stood barely above his elbows. It was a lot easier to stare at his hooves than his face. Not to mention how skinny this man was, he looked like a puff of air might topple him down and over. Krurin scratched her elbow awkwardly. It was almost a little intimidating, distracted by his sheer height, she half smiled. "Uh, yeah. Maybe some- uh selective breeding could produce that."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 06:25 PM
"I don't recall ever seeing any remotely triangular fruit..." He scratched his head - he'd never been the best at the sciences and he considered it an impossibility that he ever would be. "But I suppose anything is possible given time and effort." He had to look down at the Caitian in return - considering she barely reached his waist and a little more... and that was all. "How have you been of late?"
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 06:29 PM
[Krurin] "I've been fine, been a while since I've done anything remotely interesting. Just work, work and sleep. I eat in between of course, but a lot of the crew here has cool stuff they do. I haven't even been able to do something cool during this shore leave," she twitched her tail with a little bit of frustration. Part of her really wanted to connect with the crew more. She rarely ever wanted to focus on friends, but seeing everyone so happy together made her a little jealous. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 06:34 PM
"I'm sure there must be something you can do." Admittedly he himself couldn't really think of anything 'cool' to do - that wasn't really the way he rolled and it had never really been. "Have you any old hobbies?"
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 06:56 PM
[Krurin] "Some," she admitted with a grunt. "But they're really out of practice. I don't think it would be easy to pick them back up."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 06:59 PM
"Perhaps not - but if it might help you feel better than it may just be worth it." Like he was about to do - go home, cook himself dinner and sit down to review his obituary for Phenna. "And, well, picking up new hobbies is also a viable option." He came to stand next to her, browsing the shelves for something nice - eventually coming to find a nice-looking set of nesting dolls. (edited)
Finley Harrison 06-Nov-20 07:05 PM
[Krurin] Krurin looked around as well, so far she hadn't found anything that screeched S'Tera. "Yeah, it's viable doesn't mean it's easy," she sighed, scanning the shelves.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 06-Nov-20 07:08 PM
"Of course not." He scanned the shelves himself - was there something she was looking for in particular? "Can I help you, lieu-" Come now, just remember and use her name for once? "-Krurin? Is there something yoh are interested in in particular?"
Captain Syrezeaju 06-Nov-20 11:27 PM
[D] To the exterior of ESD another vessel had arrived, dropping out of warp only moments ago. It felt rather odd to see a Breen shuttlecraft so close considering how earlier in the year proximity to one had meant that you must be engaged in battle. Having rode the warp-trails of different starships in order to arrive at ESD, it seemed they had made it in good time.

Finley Harrison 07-Nov-20 04:14 AM

Finley Harrison 07-Nov-20 04:53 AM

Finley Harrison 07-Nov-20 05:31 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 07-Nov-20 05:35 AM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 07-Nov-20 06:28 AM

Finley Harrison 07-Nov-20 07:30 AM
[Krurin] Krurin gazed at the Andorian flute, wind instruments were never her forte. Still, it made her wistful for times past and her face softened for a moment before returning to its hard usual expression.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 07-Nov-20 08:16 AM

Finley Harrison 07-Nov-20 08:55 AM

It appeared that Olivria had managed to get the UFHC home after all.

She hadn't the foggiest idea about what to look for but she figured she'd know. But for now, Mera wandered the promenade, gazing out of the windows at the stars outside, she didn't wish to rush.
Cadet Diana Kimberly 18-Dec-20 08:31 PM
[D] Some time during the day Diana had found herself wandering around the promenade. The Cadet had been stopping at almost every shop, intrigued by everything around her, she loved to see all the items and foods and etc. Exiting out of a shop, Diana took a moment to look at her PADD as she walked. That was a mistake, as she walked right into Mera.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 18-Dec-20 08:48 PM
Oh goodness, this hadn't been at all expected but as Mera was jolted back into her body, she let out no sound at all other than a small exclamation of, "Stars above I'm sorry." A soft chuckle escaped her as she tried to see if the young cadet was alright, after all, Mera had been standing in the middle of the walkway, well, the side, but still the middle.
Cadet Diana Kimberly 18-Dec-20 08:50 PM
"Oh my god, I'm so sorry!" Diana looked up at Mera. She quickly put her PADD away, she didn't want to bump into another person. "Are ya alright? Sorry for bumping into ya!"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 18-Dec-20 09:06 PM
"No I'm fine," Mera smiled, "Are you though?" She was just making sure, of course. Mera wondered if she had any knowledge of the ESD in terms of where the pet store was. "I don't think I know where the pet store is, I haven't really looked for it myself at all." Sheepishly, Mera let out a genuine laugh at having no clue where it was. Listen, she'd been here before, sure, but never to get a pet or things for it, so how was she expected to know?
Cadet Diana Kimberly 18-Dec-20 09:39 PM
"I'm alright!" Diana smiled. "The pet store? I know where it is! I can show ya the way, if ya want? If not I can always just point in the direction, I don't want to be a bother." She let out a tiny giggle.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 18-Dec-20 10:19 PM
"That would be great actually." The El-Aurian nodded lightly. She wasn't averse to a good bit of company, especially from someone with a generally good attitude and vibe. Well, you couldn't blame her for checking vibes, really, it was simply how her brain worked.
Cadet Diana Kimberly 18-Dec-20 10:22 PM
"Alrighty! It's that way!" Diana's smile broadened as she pointed in the direction of the store. "Shall we go?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 18-Dec-20 11:36 PM
"Oh, yes, by all means lead the way." Mera's voice came eager, to see what they had in stock. Of course she began following Diana to the pet store. "Oh, I'm Mera by the way, Mera Aeonian, Ops."
Cadet Diana Kimberly 18-Dec-20 11:39 PM
"Mera is such a pretty name! I'm Diana Kimberly, Medical Cadet!" Diana walked beside Mera, a smile on her face. "Once we get there, what pet will ya get?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 18-Dec-20 11:46 PM
"You know, I'm not sure." She mused, "I guess I was just gonna see what they have there you know? I have no clue what's there in the first place, I'm just hoping I find something."
Cadet Diana Kimberly 18-Dec-20 11:48 PM
"I've heard that the store has lots of pets!" Diana looked over at Mera. "Perhaps ya could get a dog? Or a cat! Or any pet there, actually."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 19-Dec-20 12:01 AM
"Don't get me wrong," Mera started, putting her hands up gently as if to say not to take it the wrong way or anything. Unfortunately the El Aurian was a little picky about pets. "Dogs are fantastic, loyal, sweet, huggable, but a little hyper for my tastes." And she could already imagine the shedding on her uniform, not to mention the training. She certainly commended her brother Weston for having three dogs on a starship, they were each entirely adorable, but it wasn't for Mera. No, she preferred the smaller and more well behaved pets. "I'd be looking for something littler in stature, calm mostly I think."
Cadet Diana Kimberly 19-Dec-20 12:05 AM
"Maybe a cat? Some cats are really calm! And adorable, very adorable." She suggested. "Or a reptile, most reptiles aren't hyper!"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 19-Dec-20 12:14 AM
"Oh a reptile sounds lovely, I've heard that certain species of non-terran reptiles have long lifespans upwards of thirty years, it's quite comforting actually, especially if I take care of it from birth. I can't remember if it was a Betazoid hognose or a Haliian gecko." She pondered for a moment, genuinely, Mera always resorted to thinking for a good minute before leaving things to chance. Multiple seconds had passed without a broken silence from Mera before she actually answered her own question, "I suppose we'll see when we get there." Was her bashful reply.
Cadet Diana Kimberly 19-Dec-20 12:18 AM
"Yeah! Maybe you could get a bearded dragon, they are adorable!" The two were getting closer to where the pet shop was. "Geckos are cute too, I had one once."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 19-Dec-20 03:17 AM
"Oo, I do hope they have reptiles." Mused the walking woman. She did wonder if they even had pets of that variety; regardless of Mera's worry, she hoped they were almost there. There was some sort of eventuality of Mera getting a pet, she really did want one, but this could quite possibly be her day. A thought found itself adrift in her mind, what sort of reptile did she like most, that definitely had to be the Betazoid Hognose Snake, oh stars they were so cute. And they stayed small too, small and docile if a little bit playful. Even in the wild, as Mera had learned from a xenozoologist friend back on the chaser who had been writing a paper on how similar the Betazoid Hognose was to the Terran Quokka, having no natural predators and being incredibly friendly to people. "We are almost there, are we not?"

Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 19-Dec-20 06:34 PM
Lithop beamed down to the promenade and waited for Aaron. She was smiling, proud that their work was being recognized. This was the biggest thing she had done in her life, the only thing so far that got her name written down somewhere that other people on other ship might see. So far, this was her magnum opus. She laughed to herself, she was a scientist, she loved space more than she loved anything else, and the thing that got her in the books was a roomba. She smiled to herself, albeit a bit sadly. This was her start, her first checkpoint, but it wouldn't be the finish, she wanted her name to be associated with bigger, space related things. She promised herself, right there and then, she would get her name into something bigger, something about a spatial anomaly, something that could fascinate people, and maybe, just maybe. Save someone's life.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 19-Dec-20 06:40 PM
They exited the supermarket about about 15 minutes after entering, this time with a shopping bag in their hand. They made their way down the promenade and back towards the airlocks. They pulled out their PADD when they were getting near the airlocks and checked which one they wanted, before putting it back in their pocket and continuing.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 19-Dec-20 07:00 PM

After i minute she pulled out of the hug and gave him a kiss. though she still held his arms in hers so they stayed close together. "I'm so proud of us. This is really good news, especially after the past week I know that was really hard on you." She pulled him in close again. She knew that he and Malcolm were close, and the whole thing that happened with Malcolm must have hurt him. It was good to get this good news.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 19-Dec-20 07:13 PM
""Hard on me" is an understatement." He smiled. "But look at us, we designed and built the new Roomba of the fleet!" He said, as an old Roomba bumped into his leg, reversed and bumped into it again, and again, and again. After a couple of more tries it gave up and trundled in the opposite direction.
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 19-Dec-20 07:20 PM
"We did." She kissed him again. It was so nice to finally get some good news. and something that they worked so hard on. It was all so nice. "We did."

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 12:45 AM
Sara had been on the promenade for about an hour, doing a little bit of winter holiday shopping before she'd finally messaged the ship chatroom, having heard from another group of gossiping officers that the Phoenix had docked. Apparently that was a big deal. Heading over to the sushi place on the main walkway, she sent Amanda a location ping and sat back, waiting for the other woman to arrive.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 12:46 AM
[D] Amanda received the ping in the bar and hurried to the promenade. She waved at Sara and went to give her friend a hug as she got closer. "How are you?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 12:55 AM
Seeing her friend arrive, she swiveled in the chair, arms outstretched to give her a hug from sheer excitement. "I'm good! How're y- ohh gentle, gentle." She murmured, very gently giving the other blonde a hug. "How're you?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 12:56 AM
Amanda raised an eyebrow at Sara's comments. She was being gentle, or so she thought. "I'm doing OK. Tired more than anything. Are you OK? You seem like, sore or something?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 01:16 AM
"A little. Which brings me to finishing the story, come with me to the bathroom?" She asked, already stepping down from the chair with a smile, and a 'come hither' as she began to walk towards the nearby women's bathroom.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 01:20 AM
Anda shrugged and followed Sara to the bathroom. "You sound like you had a wild time back on earth. Let loose and all that."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 01:23 AM
They walked into the bathroom, and walked back out not even a minute later. "It was admittedly pretty fun- forgot I had a boyfriend and a whole department under my name. But I think this is my last wild streak- what kind of sushi do you like?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 01:26 AM
Amanda walked out of the bathroom giggling. "Everyone deserves one last romp before we settle down a bit. I like salmon, yellowtail, mackerel and a few others. Sushi is one of my favorite foods honestly."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 01:37 AM
"Oh there was no romp, no way. I'd never be forgiven, nor would I forgive myself. But I honestly never knew that- the sushi I mean. You seem more like a pasta kind of girl." They walked back over to the sushi bar, taking their seats beside one another. "I love all seafood honestly." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 01:40 AM
Amanda sat down next to Sara and indicated to the waiter that she'd like some tea. "Just because I'm from New York doesn't mean pasta isn't the only source of carbs for these guns," she said as she flexed slightly and giggled.* "I like most food to be honest. After not eating for three years, any food is good food."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 01:42 AM
"Is that... Really how the Borg worked? How did they sustain you?" It was definitely a question that Sara had never pondered too deeply, asking about someone's past, especially when the Borg were involved, was always a touchy subject, but since Amanda brought it up first it wouldn't hurt to ask a little, right?
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 01:49 AM
"Regenerating sustains drones, food, sleep, all that. No need for food or drink when the cybernetics control all the functions of your body. Very efficient but not very fun. Drones don't get sick, and if they can't be repaired when hurt, they just get scrapped. I was a primary repair drone so my designation was to repair drones, the cube we lived on and the transwarp hub we guarded." Amanda didn't mind talking about her time with the borg, as painful as it was. She knew it was therapeutic for her." So what's good here? I've never eaten at this place." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:15 AM
"Literally every piece of sashimi has been so good. I'm a super big fan of salmon, so anything with salmon is super good- uhmm.. Ohh all their spicy rolls are good too. Anything with crab..ohhhhh the avocado and shrimp maki rolls? Yum." Sara was obviously enthusiastic about getting to eat seafood. It was, in fact, her favorite food. Cuisine from her hometown was obviously seafood heavy- but she delighted in cultures that had a similar palette. "Where do you normally eat on ESD? I know there's like a million restaurants- but other than you being from New York- I don't much else about your food preferences." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:19 AM
"Well I like pizza a lot. There's a decent pizzeria on the esd, but I'm also snobby from living in New York all my life. Other than that I'll eat most things, though I have yet to find a decent falafel joint around here. I've been to Israel more times than I can count to visit family and I can only find a couple of places that compares to there." Her hand went to her neck where the sun shaped necklace was, remembering her date with Mattie on the holodeck.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:35 AM
"Oh! I didn't know you had family in Isreal! How fun! Did you like it there- other than for the falafel~" She chuckled, waving the waiter over now that they were mostly ready to order. "May I have 2 salmon rolls with the spicy mayo? And also 2 chef sashimi plates, please?" she asked, giving them a smile before looking to Amanda, waiting for her to order.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:39 AM
Amanda perused the menu for a second before she ordered. "I will have a spicy salmon roll, a yellowtail roll, a chef sashimi plate and an order of seaweed salad, thank you. Oh and a Kirin Ichiban beer. " After the waiter left, Amanda turned her attention to Sara. "It was hot, very hot, but I loved it. My cousins live there as well as a good friend of mine from high school, so it's always a good time when I go. I know all the secret nooks and crannies. I'm sure it's the same with you and Norway right?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:43 AM
"Oh of course- you can never get the real tour without a local on-hand! Do you have any pictures? I took like fifty of the Aurora lights when I was there a few weeks ago, wanna trade pics?" Oops! Sara had forgot to order a drink. When he comes back, Sara made a mental note to ask for a milk tea. If she was going to go ham- might as well do it right. "Because I've never actually been anywhere near Isreal-but I've heard it's beyond beautiful."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:47 AM
Amanda nodded and pulled out her padd, pulling up an album of pictures. "So... First off here are some pictures from in between postings around 5 years ago. You get a coveted privilege of seeing what I looked like before being all borgified." She scrolled through a few photos of a very human looking Amanda with her arm around a tanned, dark haired woman on the beach in Israel." This is in Eilat, they have beautiful beaches there. That woman is Xara, my old girlfriend. She loved going to Israel, tried to convince me to move there if we ever got married."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:55 AM
"Wow.." Sara whispered, leaning over to look at the pictures with a look of surprise. Amanda was no doubt one of the most beautiful women on the ship, and in her personal opinion, the implants kinda..haha..enhanced her beauty, but seeing her look so normal was jarring. She could have literally been a model. "You're still as gorgeous then as you are now, gosh your hair was so long-" She cooed with a hint of delight in her tone. She in turn had taken out her own PADD from her labcoat pocket and had begun to scroll past several dozen pictures of the same orange fluffball before getting to pictures of Norway. "She's really pretty too- I bet you both got a lot of stares just walking around, ja? So- why'd you two break up, you look so happy?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 04:00 AM
"We didn't really break up. I was actually thinking about asking her to marry me. But then I got taken, and after the years plus my rehab she had moved on. I don't blame her honestly, it's a long time and Starfleet told her I died. I found her after I was liberated but she... Well let's just say it wasn't the reunion I was hoping for. That being said, Mattie has been the most wonderful boyfriend. I really licked it I think." Amanda gasped at the photos." Wow it's gorgeous! I've always wanted to go to Norway and see the aurora. Try out the hot springs, eat all the fish." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 04:09 AM
"Oh. I'm. I'm really sorry." She said finally between a few bouts of awkward pause. Of course it made sense, not a lot of people would wait for their would-be spouse to magically reappear after Starfleet records were told that they'd perished. It made sense, and yet she couldn't imagine the hurt.. Knowing that someone you love so deeply you wanted to get married was with someone else. It made her own mouth sour. "Mattie really does love you, every time I've ever spoke to him, you've come up in conversation~ You two are kinda on-par with Malcolm and Amy when it comes to sickeningly sweet lovebird status.~" She chuckled, finally getting a chance to talk to the waiter again as he sped by to ask for that milk tea with a smile and a thank you.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 04:13 AM
Amanda blushed a little. "I suppose. I love him dearly and he's really been so great and caring and... Ugh sorry I'm gushing. I've been lucky. I still love Xara, but it's different now. We're both happy and that's what counts. Tell me though, how are things with you and Tal?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 04:15 AM
"Things are well. Again, I think we're still getting to know each other all over again, and it's slow..but I think that's what he needs. And honestly with me in school, and running the science department and with the arboretum being my whole pet project and now with a kitten I'm responsible for.. I guess it's okay for it to be slow."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 04:17 AM
"Well that's good. Rushing things tends to lead to disaster. I didn't know you got a kitten though. I knew you liked animals but I figured you were a dog person."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 04:24 AM
"Well, the first time we got together, it was supposed to be something really simple..More fun than anything. I'd just gotten out of a super bad relationship and he was offering me some respite. And then I got attached. I wanted more than just..drinking dates and stuff, I wanted, y'know, marriage, I wanted kids. And, ahaha, that's why we broke up! But things are a bit different now, we grew up and apart and are trying it slow again. So, We'll see~ But yeah! His name is Giblets and he's my one true love in this world-" Sara quickly pulled up a picture of the very fat, round kitten sprawled out across her pillow. "I love dogs too, I don't favor cats over dogs though. Do you?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 11:10 AM
"To be honest I don't know. I've never had a pet until Tony so I'm not sure. Growing up I didn't really have the most stable home life in terms of one place to live. My dad was always on ships and my mom was either at Starfleet medical or also on ships away. Was hard to have a pet when I spent a lot of time at relatives. No big deal though. While it was a bit unorthodox, my life is my life and I wouldn't be who I am today with it." Their food soon arrived and Amanda busied herself with getting her soy sauce situation settled." Giblets is very cute, he'll have to meet Tony someday for a proper play date..." She mulled over what Sara said about her and Tal."I can appreciate that, I truly can. I'm not the type who likes flings myself. A deep emotional connection is important. Especially if you want marriage and kids and stuff. Sometimes it takes some time apart for one to realize what the don't have and how much they truly want to be with the person, and sometimes it changes them. If you truly love someone, you'll want the same things out of life, even if it takes a little while to realize it."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 02:18 PM
The food looked amazing as per usual, just their plates alone took up nearly a quarter of the small bar they sat at. Thankfully all the plates were the same size- they could stack in the middle between them as they finished. "It's..complicated. Tal has a lot of issues with family and romance and just. I feel really bad for him, but I don't know if I'm helping or only securing his fear more. I think, for now I'm just going to enjoy the holidays and not really..think about it. Oh- speaking of holidays, Mattie told me you celebrate Hannukah! Have you two done anything fun for it?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 02:30 PM
Amanda popped a piece of salmon sashimi in her mouth and chewed thoughtfully. "Ooh it's delicious. And yeah, I do celebrate Hannukah. Mattie gave me 8 gifts... Really too much honestly. For the last day we went on date on the holodeck to Jerusalem. It's been... God it's been honestly magical, if you can believe it. I think Tal loves you genuinely. He's been noticeably happier in engineering. Just follow his lead maybe and take it his speed?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:24 PM
She nodded quietly, happily delving into her own spicy roll with a slight wince, followed by a quick hum of delight. It always stung at first, but the heat and the richness of the crab and the seaweed. Ugh. Divinity. "You think? I had just assumed it was because of Giblets~" She joked, popping a straw into her milk tea as she spoke. She took a deep sip before setting it down again. She'd probably believe Amanda more if Tal actually said things like that. "But yeah, that's the plan. Slow and steady." She smiled, confirming her thoughts by giving a slight nod as she popped another piece of sushi into her mouth. "I celebrate Yule and have only just finished my shopping while I've been here. I rented a locker for a few hours to put everything into until I was done. Once I come aboard I have like, seven bags. Tal was most assuredly the hardest to shop for- what did Mattie get you?" (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:30 PM
She ate some more sushi, realizing for the first time since they sat down that Sara had ordered as much food as her. Mentally shrugging, she swallowed and sipped her beer. "An aromatherapy diffuser, a painting of Tony, a journal, a home cooked dinner, a music player with songs he recorded, a new hutch for Tony, a date on the holodeck, and these earrings," she pointed to the sun shaped studs in her ears. "I really don't know what I did to deserve it all honestly."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:36 PM
"Ah! He's so thoughtful! They really accentuate the gold in your hair." Sara beamed, whirling her finger around in a circle in order to point at the earrings in question. "You do deserve to be treated nicely! He loves you and is trying to show you how much he cares by being involved with your cultures and celebrations!" She would neglect to mention his question towards her what even Hanukkah was- he'd apparently figured it out and had won the game. "Did you give him gifts back?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:38 PM
She shook her head, "I'm waiting for Christmas, since that's what he celebrates. I built him a retro gaming machine so he can play old games from the 20th and 21st century on it. I also have a bracelet for him, with an inscription of the stardate when we first said "I love you" to each other. Maybe a bit cheesy, I know, but I think he'll like it."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:46 PM
"Oh my gosh, Amanda he might lose his mind!~" She chuckled, giving the other woman a bright grin as she dipped a salmon sashimi into a shallow bowl of soy sauce Sara had mixed with wasabi earlier. Likely a sacrilege, but damn it, it was good. "There's nothing cheesy about that! It's really romantic I think! Have you wrapped everything yet?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:47 PM
Amanda nodded as she ate some of the seaweed salad, "yeah I just finished actually. Finally got Mattie out of my room for a few hourssssss...ohboy." She blushed furiosuly as she realized that firstly, she admitted that she had a subordinate in her quarters and secondly, that he rarely left.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:50 PM
"What?" Sara asked a bit unsurely, looking around them almost a bit anxiously. Had Mattie come up while she'd announced her presents??
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 03:54 PM
Amanda swallowed, "uh...I just...admitted to having him in my room to another senior officer...and that...he stays there. A lot. Pretty much all the time. I don't think he knows the name of his roommate."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 03:55 PM
"...So?" Sara replied with a bit of a deadpan to her voice. "Tal comes over to my room a lot too? I mean- we have bigger quarters, it's justifiable to our romantic partners that they'd come to the bigger quarters to spend time."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 04:00 PM
"I just...he's in my department and we're trying to keep things professional. So I don't want rumors to start and stuff I guess."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 04:04 PM
"Oh..I guess I am kind of a gossip, huh?" She at least had the self-awareness to look a bit embarrassed. "Well, I mean, the fact you're together isn't unknown, and I mean, you're not playing favorites, it's not like you're trying to promote him constantly or give him the easiest work..which is all Starfleet really cares about you like, not doing. But don't fret, spreading intimate business isn't the proverbial tea I'm after. I'm more into like..which ensigns have been speeding off to sanitary closets together and matchmaking and such."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 04:07 PM
"No, no I didn't mean that! I just..the captain doesn't know yet and I don't want to give her anymore stress and...I'll just shut up now."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 04:24 PM
"Amanda, really, it's not that uncommon. It's not like he's still in academy, and it's not as if there's even really an age gap. As long as you're literally going by the books on this, you're fine! Aside that, even if the captain did find out, what would she do? You're not breaking any rules. You're not being gross about it, and you're not giving him any special favors."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 04:35 PM
"No I know but, I guess I'm just waiting for the the proverbial shoe to drop. First boyfriend I had? Broke up due to final exam stresses in the academy. Next guy? Too much time separated on our ships. Xara? Borg. Now Mattie is almost too perfect and I'm just apprehensive about what could happen to mess this one up too." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 04:58 PM
"I mean, thinking it's gonna end before it's really began for the long-term is a pretty quick way to make that anxiety come to life. What about Mattie in particular makes you think things are gonna go awry- or is it just your track record you're anxious about?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 05:01 PM
"Track record mostly, but also...well after what happened with Malcolm. I was in the core with him until the last few minutes. Mattie had a very emotional response to the fact that I could have died. He argued with me about it after I tried to explain that's the life we choose as Starfleet officers. He then accused me of not thinking of him while I was in engineering. Which couldn't be farther from the truth. We talked and worked it out but...I guess that with the track record of awful has made me a bit...wary."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 06:48 PM
"While unfortunately none of us can ever preemptively tell what may go wrong at any given time, it is true that's what we sign up for as Starfleet. I mean, had he been put in your situation, wouldn't you have expected he had done the same thing you had?" She said with a somber tone, a blonde brow reaching upwards as she spoke. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 06:50 PM
"I understand what it means to be chief and if he were chief I'd expect him to do what he could to save his crew. But I wouldn't accuse him of not caring or thinking of me literally 8 hours after this all took place. I had just gotten back from assisting with repairs. No shower, no rest, I just...really needed a hug and some reassurance and I didn't get it. So it hurt. We worked it out at least."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 06:57 PM
"Mattie is a young guy, and It's not like I'm giving him a free pass just because most guys are.. I'm not really sure how to say 'less emotionally intelligent' without sounding mean, but he loves you! And because he does, he's selfish with the time he gets to have with you. And in those moments of fright and unsureness, It's practically human nature to speak selfishly from the heart." She gave the other blonde a soft smile, bumping her shoulder into hers affectionately. "But I am really proud of you guys for working it out so quickly, disagreements like that can escalate pretty fast." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 07:05 PM
Amanda gave Sara a soft smile. "You sure you didn't want to go into counseling? You're pretty darn good at it. The same could be said for Tal you know, even though he's older than you."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 07:10 PM
"Heh~ Did you know that when I first got into Starfleet, I actually considered being a nurse? Turns out I'm scared of medbay though- so it's just as well. But we can pretend-councel each other, ja?" She smiled brightly, taking a few more bites of her food before stacking her first two plates near the edge. "I think I have a thing for older guys. Every guy I've ever been interested in has been older than me by at least a couple years, the last two.. ten years difference. At what point does that become a fetish I wonder?" She laughed aloud at that as she stirred her milk tea, the dark tapioca balls swirling as she moved her straw. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 07:15 PM
"Eh, age is just a number. That's what my mom says all the time. She's at Starfleet medical and you'd think I'd be more wary of sickbay but, I don't mind. As long as you're happy, age or species shouldn't matter." Amanda stacked her plates on top of Sara's and chuckled." Don't take this the wrong way, but you can surely eat a lot. I didn't expect someone so petite to be able to eat like I can."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 07:36 PM
"Ah! Sorry! I just haven't eaten all day and I've been so hungry waiting on the shuttle. I mean, I could have eaten at the academy cafeteria, but I wanted sushi so bad!" She chuckled nervously, holding a quick hand to her cheek before settling it back into her lap. "And honestly this is my favorite spot to get it so.. I guess I am indulging a bit." She shrugged, as if almost purposely popping another piece of spicy sushi into her mouth with a cheeky grin. "You should see me put away alfredo." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 07:38 PM
"Oh no, I find it impressive and awesome. No need to be dainty on my account, trust me, I can eat my weight in pizza. When I first got my digestive system back, I ate three whole pizzas on my own just to make up for lost eating time." Amanda gave Sara a wink and ate another piece herself.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 07:46 PM
"Pft, I'm hardly dainty. I'll have you know I can deadlift forty pounds by myself!" Her tone was triumphant as she crossed her arms in front of herself looking quite pleased, as if that was a feat to be incredibly proud of. That was, roughly, two engineering toolbags.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 07:48 PM
Amanda stared for just a moment before erupting into laughter, her arms going to hold her sides as she laughed. Tears started to stream from her eyes as she tried to get a reign on her laughter. She dabbed at her eyes with a napkin before somewhat being able to speak. "I'm...I'm so sorry Sara. I didn't mean to laugh but...40 pounds? That's like...I mean...I can deadlift 285lbs." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 07:57 PM
Pink quickly dusted her cheeks at Amanda's uproarious laughter, followed shortly by a vibrant red as other officers began to look over to see what was so funny. She had in the very least thought forty was pretty good..guess not. Hiding half her face with the width of her palm, she looked to Amanda with an almost pout. "Well not all of us are built like Amazon folklore goddesses, Amanda! Forty pounds is good! ...Probably!"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 08:00 PM
Amanda took a few more moments to settle down before rubbing at her cheeks, which had started to hurt from laughter. "I'm so sorry Sara, forty pounds is like lifting Giblets and Tony together. My dad is enormous and that's where I get it from, and I mean, working in engineering you have to be decently strong. I'm sorry if I embarrassed you, but it was just too funny."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 08:09 PM
"Gibs is like five pounds at best!" She cried out, looking almost insulted as she stood up a bit straighter in her seat. Even still, her expression was still one of a childish pout despite Amanda's apology. She of course accepted it, but she still had the right to sulk a bit! "My entire family is huge too, just me and my twin are the runts because we were early- or at least that's what they assume happened. All my other siblings are super big. But it's..it's alright, I guess in retrospect it's really not all that much compared to the kind of heavy lifting you guys do all day. In science, I lift a package of petri dishes and I'm practically a war queen."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 08:11 PM
"Being giant isn't all it's cracked up to be. Do you know how many times a day I smash my head on the jeffries tubes or the EPS conduits? It's a good thing I have all this borg tech on my head or I'd have had at least a dozen concussions. I also did not know you had a twin, or even other siblings."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 08:26 PM
"Oh my gosh, Amanda. There's fourteen of us total." Sara whispered, her tone incredibly amused. There was no turning back now, with her PADD still out on the table, she took it off the counter and began to quickly swipe downwards towards what seemed like a bunch of family photos. A wedding. "My twin Sophie and I are the younger set of identicals. Our older brothers Samuel and Sawyer are the other set. But we have two sets of fraternal as well- Sable and Sabrina, and Salem and Salas. Dad is an identical, and Mom has a pair in her sibling group as well. Guess it kinda trends." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 08:29 PM
"Wow...that's...a lot of kids. I'm an only child and I can't imagine growing up with all that noise in a house." She looked at the photos with rapt attention and soon after pulled up a photo of a younger Amanda with her parents: A smiling Miranda with her blond curls and a half smiling and very tall Jason standing ramrod straight, both her panrets with their Starfleet uniforms on and Amanda clad in her own with Ensign's pips on. "That was just before I went off on my first assignment under my dad."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 08:56 PM
"I mean, yes of course it was a bit loud, and a bit busy, but all of us were fairly well behaved kids. I can say that much for them at least!" Sara meanwhile could barely fathom the thought of being an only child, she'd had a conversation with Oskar about the concept once, but it was just too foreign. How did they deal with all that pressure expected of them as an only child? How did they ever get away with anything? "Honestly to me it sounds more aggravating to be an only child. How were you not crushed under their expectations? Carrying on family name, succeeding in school, especially since both of your parents are starfleet.. Just seems like a lot of pressure as opposed to 'Don't kill anybody, and don't join gangs.' That was it. That was the bar they held for us."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 09:04 PM
Amanda held out her hands as if to agree with Sara's point. "My dad was chief engineer on the USS Pyongyang for years and is now a Vice Admiral of Engineering. My mom is a well respected doctor at Starfleet medical. Expectations were hanging over my head from the moment I was born. Even now, they're still around. I took Mattie to meet my mom and she told him he needed to make lieutenant before he proposed to me. Like, I know she's jokigg but my dad? He would never approve of me seeing an ensign."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 09:09 PM
Lithop stormed out of the aquarium keeping her head down and trying to ignore the taste of blood in her mouth and the burning of tears in her eyes. She was on her way to the airlock when she, quite literally bumped into Sara and Amanda. She immediately looked up. "Oh! Crap, sorry. I didn't mean to bump into you guys." She said impulsively before realizing that it was Sara and Amanda that she had bumped into. She cursed herself mentally for cursing in front of two commanding officers, one of which was her boss. She looked at them before apologizing again. "I'm sorry, I didn't mean to swear in front of you guys."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 09:19 PM
Sara was a bit startled by the bump, but nothing fell off the table nor wasn't any food wasted, so it was no foul on anyone's part. Swirling in her chair to see Lithop, She immediately noticed the Ensign's tear streaked face, and sour expression. Had something happened? She looked at her left, and then her right, before taking the younger woman closer into the circle between herself and Amanda. "No, no, honey, it's okay! Are you okay? You're looking a bit.. waterlogged." The conversation she'd been having with Amanda would be safe for another day, as she still kept lookout for the would-be assaulter of her Ensign. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 09:21 PM
Amanda was jostled a bit by the bump, but when she saw Lithop in such a state, any thoughts of annoyance left her mind as Sara pulled her in. "Hey don't worry about it. Who do I need to beat up? Because you don't get upset like this over nothing."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 09:31 PM
"Oh, uhh, well." She wanted to tell the other women that it was nothing, that she was upset over nothing, but she couldn't, because what just happened wasn't just nothing. It had hurt. "Well, you know that Roomba project Aaron and I did a while back, the one that was just approved for fleetwide use. I sent a thank you note to the admirals, and they told my I wasn't credited in the project." She explained, while sitting down on a chair at the sushi place. She needed to not be standing for this story. "And to make everything so much worse, I found out while out celebrating with Aaron. Of course I got mad, I mean, who wouldn't if you we'rent credited on something you worked hard on." She took a deep breath to try to calm down, it didn't help much. "I confronted him about it, and all he could say was that he was sorry. That's all he said! 'I'm sorry', what the hell was he thinking!"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 09:39 PM
Sara openly gaped at the story, her expressions shifting between confusion understanding and then horror, however the last one might have been tanged with a type of fury the blonde had never known before. Aaron was her cousin, though not by blood, she still felt a familial obligation to right this wrong. " Oh Lithop.. I'm so sorry, do you want me to talk to him? Though I'm sure now that you've mentioned it, he will edit the creditation, ja?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 09:43 PM
Amanda felt her hands ball to fists. Aaron was her subordinate and friend, but she guessed he could still be a jerk. "That's terrible Lithop, I'm so sorry. I can speak to him as his boss if you want, and I can be very... Direct." (edited)
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 09:51 PM
"Oh, no, uh. Don't talk to him. or do. I don't know." She groaned, putting her head on the table. "I've already talked to the admirals, so my name will be put credited on the project, but it still hunts. I don't know if he forgot or what but it's making me feel bad. How could he have forgotten to put my name on the project that started our relationship." She was a bit calmer now, and her head was clearing from the angry fog. "Am I over reacting? One one hand it was probably an honest mistake. but on the other hand, how could he have made that mistake? After everything I've done for him, I ask him out on more dates, I'm the one who asked him out to the ball, I dragged him home after he got himself wasted. maybe it's ust the angry at the situation talking, but it feels the I'm the more active person in the relationship." She sighed, low key wishing for a drink. "But then again maybe I'm just overreacting."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 09:56 PM
"No, I don't think you're overreacting at all. You put your time, effort, and knowledge into that project. It may have started out as his idea, but with as much work as you have put into it, you definitely deserve partial credit." Sara shook her head and mild disbelief, a few blonde strands shaking loose as she did so. All men really were cut from the same cloth, weren't they? "While he may not have meant to do that, that was still really rude, and not at all what was proper to say. But I also don't think that you're overreacting by wanting an apology, and an explanation. However to get those things in a timely manner, you must take a deep breath, and relax yourself, ja? Being upset will only make your words venomous, and won't make talks with Aaron productive."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 10:04 PM
"What Sara said. You absolutely deserve more than a paltry sorry, but you also have to approach this with calm. Men get more scared when you're calm like a black widow. They fear the calm." Amanda was attempting to put a little humor to Lithop's situation. "If cool as a cucumber and approach this with poise, he'll be a sputtering mess."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 10:20 PM
Lithop listened to what both women had to say, even laughing at Amanda's Black widow jokes. "Thanks guys, I think I'll take a while off until I try to talk to him. This was our first big conflict, and we've never talked about what we want out of the relationship." She took a deep breath feeling much better, but not completely forgetting her anger. "I want to make sure our goals line up before we go much further, this argument has kind of been a wake up call for me."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 10:35 PM
"Oh god, that's such a mood." Sara replied, almost exhaustedly. "Highly, and I cannot stress this enough, highly recommend that you do that. You don't want to waste a lot of your time on someone whose goals don't align with yours." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 10:37 PM
"Absolutely. Lay it all out flat and let him know honestly what you want out of the relationship. It's easier if you get it out in the open quickly. I have no doubt he cares about you and it doesn't seem like him to make such a big error. Maybe it was just a mistake. I'd think he deserves the chance to explain himself at least."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 10:56 PM
"Thank you, I feel so much better now." She stayed sitting there for a while long, they needed to make sure their long term goals matched, but the more Lithop though the more confused she felt. What were her life goals? They seemed to have changed drastically though the last few months, and she didn't know what her goals were anymore. It was a good thing she'd have plenty of time to think. "Thank you guys." She said again, standing up this time. "I didn't mean to intrude on your meal, and I should probably get back to the ship now, I have a lot to think about."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 10:59 PM
"Oh Don't worry honey, I think Amanda and I were almost done. At least, I'm almost done with my plates. Though I was considering getting a quick dessert before heading back to the ship. Do you want to snag a bit of dessert with us? Something sweet might make you feel a little better as well."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 11:01 PM
Amanda nodded towards Lithop, "yeah feel free. Dessert always makes me feel better at least. Not that I need an excuse to have dessert."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 11:02 PM
Lithop nodded and smiled. "Yeah, yeah I'd like that."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 11:03 PM
"I've been eyeing up their peanut butter daifuku ever since I sat down, I think that's what I'm going to get. What about you two?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 11:04 PM
"I think I'll have a red bean Taiyaki, they're so delicious."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 11:08 PM
"I think I'll have a red bean Taiyaki too, I remember liking them when i was younger and my uncle took me to a whole bunch of restaurants." She smiled at the memory.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 11:09 PM
The waiter standing nearby knotted as he jotted down their orders and sent the paper to the back for the dishes to be prepared. "Was that when you still lived in Alaska, Lithop?"
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 11:12 PM
"Yes, but my uncle lived, and still lives, in Seattle. I would visit him a lot because of my leg. He's the one the built it." She explained, she loved the days she spent in Seattle. Throughout history it had been a very progressive city, and therefore hosted a large non human population. She was very happy that her cousin would be able to grow up there.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 11:15 PM
Their respective dishes came back to the bar fairly quickly Sara having gotten the peanut butter daifuku, and both Amanda and Lithop having gotten the red bean taiyaki. Of course, all three plates looked absolutely amazing. "Oh yeah, I remember you saying something to that effect, when's the last time that you actually got to visit your uncle?" (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 11:15 PM
"Ooh Alaska is one of my favorite places to visit. I got to do some fishing there on an old fishing boat and it was so much fun."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 11:21 PM
"We lived in mainland Alaska, so I've never been on a fishing boat, out town was however an old gold mining town, most active during the 21st century." She talked about Alaska fist before talking about her uncle because she had a hunch they'd be more interested in it. "I actually visited my aunt and uncle last shore leave, not in Seattle though, they were in San Francisco for Rebecca's birth."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 11:34 PM
She wasted very little time popping one of the small pink mochis into her mouth as she listened to the younger woman speak. She nodded her head as she finished, swallowing quickly before grabbing another. "Oh yeah that's right, didn't you get to go see Rebecca's birth on that shore leave?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 11:35 PM
"Oh you're an aunt! That's so awesome. I am also a fun super cool cousin." Amanda smiled proudly and took a bite of the delicious pastry. (edited)
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 20-Dec-20 11:43 PM
"Well we're cousins, but because of the age gap... yeah I'm like her aunt." She laughed, finally taking a bite of her food. "And yeah, we got to attend her birth. We weren't in the room when it happened, request of her bio mom, but it was a really really nice experience." She thought about the experience, and figured that yeah, she would love to children some day. Maybe have one be her biological kid, but she would also love the Howard family tradition of adoption.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 11:44 PM
"You seem more like a wine aunt, Amanda." Sara chuckled, crossing one leg over the other as she took the plate of mochi in hand and began to eat a bit more heartily.
"But Lithop that's really lovely, little kids are such fun, especially babies! You can dress them up however you want, and they just coo and babble, and as long as they're clean and fed they're just kind of happy to hang out, and I just think they're neat~"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 20-Dec-20 11:48 PM
"I suppose I could be," She chuckled as she took another piece of taiyaki. "When I saw my cousin for the first time it was pre-borg. I saw her again post borg and she's like 5 now and she tried to pry on of my head plates off. Said I was wearing a costume. I told her I was half robot and if she didn't listen to her mom I was going to turn her into one."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 20-Dec-20 11:51 PM
"Ohmigod, that's so mean!" Sara laughed once again, but it definitely sounded like something Amanda would say. Though she wondered if it actually worked. "Though that is a relief that she's not scared of you, I know a lot of little kids have a little bit of trepidation regarding mechanical bits." (edited)
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:00 AM
Lithop laugh along with them. "Rebecca is my only reletive who's younger than I am, It'll be fun to play with her when she's a bit older." She took another bite of food. "I think I'd like to have kids someday. Not soon, but someday." She took a deep breath, that was the first time she'd said that out loud, and now even though she was fighting with Aaron, she still loved him. Lithop took a another bite before deciding to ask a rather sensitive question. "Amanda, you don't have to answer if you don't want to, it might be a bit sensitive, but can Ex Borg have biological children?" She looked down at her plate, really unsure why she asked the question and now worried that she did. She was just fighting with her boyfriend, how would the other women react to her question, how would Amanda react to the question. oh god, maybe Lithop didn't want to know the answer. What answer did she want to hear, if any. She looked down at her plate and continued to eat.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:02 AM
"Yeah? How many do you think?" Sara asked curiously, giving Lithop a good-natured grin. She'd finished her mochi and set the plate off to the stack in the middle of the table, now satisfied.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:04 AM
"It depends honestly. Length of time in the collective, what body systems the cybernetics invaded. It's table a case by case situation. Can ex borgs have children? Some can, some can't. Can I? Yes I can. I'm very lucky in that regard. Do I was by to have kids? Absolutely, with the right person." Her hand unconsciously went to her necklace.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:08 AM
"That question applies to you too, Amanda." Sara tacked on last minute, she also happened to see her touch her necklace. Interesting~
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:11 AM
Ok, Amanda's reply made her feel better and she took a calming breath. She was fine, for now at least. She turned to Sara's question. "Maybe a few, Alice would already be like my child if Aaron and I go further." She laughed at that before continuing. "But I'd like to adopt, continue the Howard tradition of adoption. And maybe have a Biological child of my own. I don't know, And I'm not sure I should be making plans about the future, especially because we're an starfleet, and then the thing that just happened with Aaron." She frowned, thinking of what had just happened less than an hour ago. She was less mad now, but she still felt very conflicted about everything, especially as the conversation with Sara and Amanda continued.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:13 AM
"Well there's no rush on deciding. You still have a long life ahead of you. Kids will come when the time is right. And to answer your question Sara, two."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:15 AM
"People have kids in Starfleet all the time! Most wait until they're in pretty good positions, usually with their own quarters and stuff, but there's really no determining factor. Starfleet can't keep you from having a family. And, even if things don't work out with Aaron you're a beautiful woman and you're so smart and kind, any person would be lucky to have you! And you know what? Be sure he knows that, keep him on his toes."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:19 AM
She nodded. "You're right, I have plenty of time." She tooked another bite and then snorted, thinking of something. "If it doesn't work out with Aaron I'm going back to women." She joked.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:21 AM
"Ugh. Lucky." Sara muttered, her face almost pouty as she took up her milk tea to her mouth once more and took a deep sip. "Did you fancy anyone before Aaron?"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:21 AM
"Heh... That's what I said about Mattie. Both are fine."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:26 AM
"Short romance with my academy roommate, but we didn't get very far before realizing we're better off as friends." She answered. "And the passing attraction to people I've seen around."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:27 AM
"It happens pretty easy, doesn't it? When I first got here I felt like I had a new crush every 5 minutes! There's just a lot of really attractive people on the Phoenix.. It's actually kind of weird.."
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:27 AM
"We're a hot crew what can I say? Also... You didn't answer your own question. How many kids do you want Sara?"
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:28 AM
"Most attracive ship in the fleet!" She laughed. "They put the smart people on the Enterprise and put the pretty people on the Phoenix."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:29 AM
"Ten." There was no question in her voice, she had apparently had this number on standby for a while. "It's a good, round number. Not quite as big as I was raised with, but still comfortably large enough, y'know?"
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:30 AM
"Ten!" She almost spit out her food. "Sorry, the only pair of siblings in my family are my Mamma and Uncle, so ten just seems like a lot."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:31 AM
"I mean? I have 13 siblings, I think 10 is very reasonable!"
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:32 AM
"Wow ten? Hopefully Tal has enough... Energy for that." Amanda being an only child was dumb founded at that amount. "That's like a basketball team."
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:32 AM
She snorted at "Energy" "Amanda, no!" She laughed.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:33 AM
"Tal said no. Like! He didn't even consider it! Just straight out no, can you believe that?" She shook her had softly, closing her eyes.
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:34 AM
"Amanda yes! That is a perfectly fair question. And Sara, ten for most families is a lot. Maybe you can talk him into it eventually but understand most human families have 2-3 kids."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:35 AM
"What the hell is that supposed to mean? "Most human families" I am human!" She cried out in fake desperation, intentionally acting offended though it was very clear that she was not in the slightest. "I thought you guys were my friends, and here you are ganging up on me-" (edited)
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 21-Dec-20 12:39 AM
"Most Bajoran families are pretty small too." She pointed out. "the majority of human familes have 3 kids or less, and I'm not deffending Tal's outright no, but I at least understand where he's coming from especally if he's weary about having kids in the fist place. Imagine you're again of having children, and the person you love say that if you get married, you need to have 10 kids. I would panic.*
Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:40 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 21-Dec-20 12:50 AM

Lt. Cmdr. Amanda Higgins 21-Dec-20 12:51 AM
