Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 02:58 AM
[D] The pair walked onto the promenade and began their search in earnest. "You mentioned you enjoy reading, are there any genres you particularly enjoy?" he asked T'lith as he browsed a set of bookshelves.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 03:00 AM
"I enjoy, every genre. But mystery seems to intrigue me the most." T'lith replied, looking at the books. It was taking a lot of willpower for her not to just pick up a bunch of books and buy them. She was looking for her recipient, not for herself.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 03:07 AM
"Oh, mystery hmm? Have you tried any Cardassian enigma tales? They are what we consider mystery, but they're quite different from traditional whodidits-- I think that's the human expression, anyway." He selected a book of Andorian poetry and then forced himself to put it back. He was allowing his personal tastes to color his choices and if he did that, the recipient was going to end up with some very strong alcohol and a few trashy romance novels and poetry collections. He tried to find something that said 'Betazoid' but unfortunately this bookshop was not tailored to socially awkward Cardassian security chiefs who struggle with gift giving.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 04:36 PM
"I haven't tried any Cardassian, enigma tales. Perhaps I will try to read one." T'lith looked around the shop. Who knew getting gifts could be so hard? "Have you found a gift for your recipient yet?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 04:50 PM
He sighed. "I have not. Have you?" The bookshelves were full of fascinating tomes that he would love to spend all day exploring, but he was struggling to make a choice for the gift exchange. A few Cardassian enigma tales lay on a display table nearby and he picked one up. "Perhaps we should try another shop where we aren't so tempted to shop for ourselves?"
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 04:51 PM
"I haven't found a gift for my recipient yet." She replied, looking over at Parlac. "Perhaps you are right. We should, go look in another shop."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 05:04 PM
Parlac moved from the bookshop to a stall that appeared to carry a multitude of different types of tea. "Oh, this seems promising. Who doesn't like tea?" He paused. "Well, I suppose some people might not like tea. But most people do. Perhaps a nice collection of tea blends? That's... relatively safe, I think." He looked over at T'lith, hoping the Vulcan might logically come to the same conclusion.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 05:07 PM
T'lith didn't notice that Parlac was talking to her for a few seconds, too distracted with finding a gift. But when she did notice, the Vulcan looked over at him, raising an eyebrow. "I believe a tea blend would be, safe." She replied before going back to looking for a gift.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 05:30 PM
He nodded appreciatively. "I thought so." The tea shop had a vast selection, and he busied himself with choosing different tins and putting them into a gift box. Unsure what his exchange recipient would enjoy, he attempted to find as many different options as possible. Some terran black teas found their way into the box, followed by a Vulcan tea he'd never heard of, and some Bajoran fruit blends went next. A Cardassian red leaf tea was selected-- this was one of his favorites, and he couldn't imagine anyone not liking it, so he added another tin of the same type as well. He picked a few more tins and then neatly arranged them in a grid inside the box, nestled among some fine shreds of colored red paper. Pleased with his work, Parlac turn to T'lith. "What do you think? Not bad for someone who has no idea what Christmas is," he chuckled, "I think I might get a nice tea set to go with it."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 05:33 PM
T'lith had picked out a gift too. Well, something that might be a gift for her recipient. "I think it looks appropriate for a, Christmas gift. I believe your recipient will, enjoy the gift."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 05:48 PM
Parlac grinned. "Good. What have you selected for your recipient?" A little black porcelain tea set with gold leaf inlay had caught his eye, and he boxed it up and added it to his basket.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 05:51 PM
"A book, about Engineering in the past. Also, a sweater." In her arms there was a book, most likely the Engineering book, and a maroon colored sweater.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 05:53 PM
"Ideal. Logical choices, I'm sure your recipient will be pleased." He looked down at the bare cardboard boxes and considered them for a moment. "I have very little understanding of Christmas and the associated traditions, but I believe there are, er, colors and themes associated with them. And that the gifts are meant to be wrapped. Perhaps we could find a shop that offers those colored papers? I think Christmas is, uh..." He wracked his memory, trying to remember which holiday party he'd attended onboard the Renegade. "Purple? And green and orange? I think also pumpkins are involved-- a sort of orange gourd."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 05:57 PM
T'lith raised an eyebrow. "I believe you are correct about green being a Christmas color. But I think that pumpkins are a, Halloween thing." Maybe she should have read more about Christmas, the Vulcan really didn't know anything about it.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:00 PM
"Oh, hm." His brow furrowed as he tried vainly to remember anything else about Christmas. "Well, green is close enough I suppose, seeing as we both seem to remember it." He stepped back out onto the promenade and looked for a generic gift shop. "Are you sure the pumpkins are Halloween? Which one is Halloween again? Is that the one where they have lots of food and eat themselves into a coma?"
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:02 PM
"A coma?" T'lith looked over at him. "I believe Halloween is where, everyone dresses up in costumes and, eats candy. I think."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:05 PM
"Ahhhh, that's right. They have so many holidays to keep track of. Maybe the food one is Valentine's Day. I know they eat a lot of chocolate for that one, which I personally quite enjoy." He stepped into a shop that appeared to have a multitude of different colors of paper on display. "This should do, I think. Let's find something green."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:06 PM
"I have not heard of a holiday called, Valentine's Day. What is it about?" T'lith started to look for green paper.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:09 PM
"As far as I can work out, you eat chocolate until you feel sick and then, depending on whether you are in a relationship or not, you either go on a date or you watch sad holovids alone in your quarters. An odd tradition, but I do enjoy the chocolate." Parlac selected a roll of lime green paper with little leaves on them-- clovers, but he didn't know what they were called. It was green and as far as he was concerned, that meant it was Christmas.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:10 PM
"I believe this is, Christmas paper?" T'lith was looking at some red and green paper which had Christmas trees on them. "Maybe this would, work. Unless those are not Christmas trees?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:13 PM
"Well it does have green on it. And trees. Trees and other plants do appear to be part of the festivities surrounding this holiday," he gestured to his own roll of paper, "So I assume that would be appropriate."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:16 PM
T'lith nodded. "I suppose both of the papers are, Christmas colors."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:22 PM
"Alright, shall we head back to the ship or do you have any other errands you need to run while at spacedock? I'd be happy to get the wrapping done with you as well, if you like." He had selected a few rolls of bright green ribbons and a large, sparkly green bow.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:24 PM
"I was, thinking about getting some gifts for my, friends." She replied. "I just have to find the right gifts."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:30 PM
"Hm, I'm not sure which crewmates celebrate this holiday and which don't, but I would guess it's safe to assume all the humans celebrate it, right? I could try to find something nice for Dr. Carlisle and Lieutenant Bjørge, as I believe I have made friends with both." The Cardassian considered for a moment, then smiled. "Yes, I think I know what I could pick up for Blanche. I suppose it won't be too difficult to convince you to accompany me back to the bookshop we were in earlier?"

Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:32 PM
"It wouldn't be too difficult." T'lith raised an eyebrow. "Shall we head back to the bookshop?"

"Yes, we shall." He smiled and started walking in the direction of the shop they had previously left. Once there, he started digging through the poetry section looking for a few Iloja collections. "What did you have in mind for your friends, Ensign?"
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:36 PM

Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:43 PM
"Commander Carlisle like's poetry?" T'lith looked at the books on the shelf in front of her, perhaps Sara would like one of the books?
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:46 PM

So these books are specifically by a quite famous Cardassian poet, Iloja of Prim, and will be part of her education in Cardassian culture."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:48 PM
"Then I believe she will enjoy the gift you are getting for her, if she is intrigued in learning traditional Cardassian rituals." T'lith replied. Spotting a book, the Vulcan picked it up, looking at the cover.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 06:56 PM
Parlac was eyeing a novel that said 'Fire in the Winter Soul: Book 3' and under that in smaller text 'The thrilling conclusion to the political romance between an Andorian diplomat and a Vulcan assassin.' He picked it up and added it to his basket as discreetly as possible. "Hm? Oh, yes, I think she'll enjoy it. Iloja is a fine poet." He moved over to the data rod section and started working through the available titles.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 06:57 PM
"Lieutenant, do you think this book would be a good gift for Sara?" T'lith held out the book. "It's a romance, I believe I once heard that she enjoyed reading, romance novels."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:02 PM
He started and glanced down. "I don't know anything about romances! I'm not sure I'd be able to help much in that department. But uh, let me look." He took the offered novel and scanned the description. 'Sin and Sinuous' the book's cover declared in embossed silver over a painting of a muscled Klingon man with his arm around the waist of a busty and petite human woman with fiery red hair. "I'm no expert, but the premise sounds... interesting." He made a mental note to circle back later, alone, to pick up a copy for himself.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:04 PM
T'lith still held onto the book, if she couldn't find another one she'd get that book for Sara. The Vulcan walked around, looking for other books.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:07 PM
With the knowledge that the Lieutenant enjoyed romance novels now added to his mental database regarding the crew, Parlac realized he could now add several more novels to his basket without attracting undue scrutiny. 'How to Wed a Rascal' went in next, followed by 'An Inconvenient Flame' and 'Trial of the Senses: A Betazoid Romance in Two Parts'.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:09 PM
"I thought that finding a gift would be, easy." T'lith admitted as she looked around. "I was incorrect, it is difficult to find the right gift."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:10 PM
"I agree, this is quite a bit more difficult than I anticipated. I am most grateful for your company, it has made this task far more pleasant than had I attempted it on my own."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:13 PM
"It is, agreeable to have company when looking for a gift." She replied. T'lith now had three books in her arms, but she definitely was going to get more books for Sara. And maybe even some flowers? She hadn't decided yet.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:21 PM
Parlac had wandered over to a stall that sold jewelry just across from the bookshop. Jewelry was often given as gifts among humans, as far as he could tell, and so he began to browse the pieces on display while making sure he remained within earshot of T'lith.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:29 PM
T'lith now had around ten books in her arms, which she had paid for already, and was now looking at some flowers at a nearby stall that sold plants. She shifted the books in her arms, the Vulcan didn't seem to mind the weight of all the books as she looked at the flowers.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:37 PM
"That's quite a lot of books, Ensign," Parlac said with a soft chuckle. "Are those all gifts?" He had found a necklace that bore a tiny silver hanging planter with little enameled green leaves pouring out of it. The chief was not particularly familiar with different types of jewelry, but he thought it seemed appropriate for the Lieutenant. He added it to his basket. (edited)
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:38 PM
"They are all gifts." She replied, looking at the flowers. "Should I get some flowers for Sara as well? Or would it be, too much."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:41 PM
"I don't think the Lieutenant would ever say no to flowers," he answered thoughtfully, "A good choice, Ensign. What do you think of this necklace?" He held up the little plant on a chain.
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:43 PM
T'lith looked over at Parlac, raising an eyebrow as she looked at the necklace. "If that necklace is for Sara, I believe it would suit her. It is, very pretty." Pretty, she hadn't used that word in while.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 07:50 PM
"Good. Pretty is good." The necklace was returned to his basket. "Anything else on your list?"
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 07:51 PM
"There is nothing else. I just have to, pay for these flowers, and perhaps get a basket for all these books. Is there anything else that you need to get?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 08:01 PM
"That's all for me. I've got a few other friends in mind but as they are not humans, it seems odd to purchase them a gift for a human custom that neither of us celebrate. So as it stands, I think just the gifts I've found will be all I need. Shall we head back to the ship then?"
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 08:05 PM
T'lith nodded. "I just need to pay for these flowers and get a basket and then we can leave." The Vulcan quickly paid for the flowers, also paying for a basket, in which she put the flowers and books in. Since T'lith's writer almost forgot about this, the Vulcan's recipients gift was wrapped up in the green paper and in her arms.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 21-Dec-20 08:11 PM
Parlac tried not to talk too quickly back to the ship, but he was eager to get back to the relative quiet of his own quarters. "I suppose that went quite well, all things considered. You are an excellent shopping companion, Ensign T'lith."
Lt. JG. T'lith 21-Dec-20 08:14 PM
"You are a, good shopping companion as well." She replied. "Now that I know the difficulty of finding a gift, perhaps I will not sign up for Secret Santa next year."
Ensign Nedras 22-Dec-20 07:08 PM
He started perusing the shops for the incredibly specific item he had in mind. Fortunately, it was relatively easy to find, smack between the Vulcan meditation lamps and some kind of... what he assumed was a miniature sculpure of a vulcanoid spy in red and white - nope, wrong assessment, that was an Elf on the Shelf. How vintage. It seemed the shop had understandably miscategorized it. The item he was looking for was a yule log-shaped lamp...thing with holographic battery-powered flames in a small-fireplace shaped box. It gave off a little bit of heat, and was about the size of a snowglobe. Hopefully, that would work, even though Yule was... he checked his PADD... yep, technically over. No matter. After informing the 'cashier', to use an antiquated term, that the yule log, now gift wrapped, a fountain pen, and a card were about to leave inventory, he left.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 25-Dec-20 01:43 AM
Cas materialized onto the promenade, finding it bustling with people- after all, it was still the holidays. A few quick laps around informed her of what most of the shops were selling. It was a little late, though she supposed that beared little on the status of the shops. She eventually found one of the items she was looking for in a small shop stocked with several types of beverages and spices. She was about to leave for another store in search of something for herself (it was the holidays- the perfect time for a little treat, she reasoned), before her eyes settled on something- deka tea. She smiled, and picked some out for herself. She bought a small box for the gift and a bag for her tea, then left the promenade for the airlock.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 04:44 AM
A look of determination was set upon Mera's features as she gathered a few choice selections of, in her opinion, the best Chinese takeout dishes. "My personal favorite is a HotPot, by far the most diverse of the individual dishes. It's different cuts of meat and a boiling broth at the table to cook it in and there's also a great many side dishes. It's like a tasting menu of sorts."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 04:46 AM
Parlac followed after her, nodding dutifully and trying not to be too distracted by Bedlam, who was trying to hog as much attention as possible by being cuter than he had any right to be. "Hoht poht," he said, trying the words out in Standard.
3
3
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 04:55 AM
"Yes, exactly, what kinds of meats do you eat? I know you eat fish, and also eggs, but what about red? Red meat isn't exactly central so we could switch it out for really any variety of meat they have. Oh and seafood, typically arthropods and also fish, obviously. I just want to gage what is going to be comfortable but also new for you." Mera quickly tried to recall the most common ingredients, Seafood, Mushroom, Broth, Red Meat, Soy Products, too many vegetables, stars there were so many, Oh, and of course noodles. "Can you eat with chopsticks?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 05:06 AM
"I'll eat just about anything, to be perfectly honest," he said, with the decency to look somewhat ashamed at the admission, "Seafood, red meat, poultry, it's all acceptable-- and generally delicious. As for-- did you call them 'chohp stecks'? I am unfamiliar with this utensil. Given the context, I would assume this replaces er-- a spoon?" It was his best guess, given that the 'hot pot' sounded like a soup, and soups were traditionally eaten with spoons. He didn't exactly care for the term 'spoon' in Standard, preferring the Kardassi word for it that did not bear negative connotations, so if this 'chohp steck' could replace the spoon he was very interested.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 05:18 AM
"Oh wonderful, that's good for me then, considering you're open to anything." Mera nodded, taking note of his enthusiasm, this was fun, "No, though we do have spoons. Chopsticks are two sticks of the same exact nature in size and shape, the idea is you use them to pinch and grab hold of the food that you're about to eat." She used her free hand to imitate the motion with two fingers.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 05:23 AM
This concept didn't particularly click with the idea of consuming soup, but he nodded as he watched her demonstrate. Perhaps he was missing something that would become obvious when he actually saw 'chohp stecks' in action. "I see. Any other recommendations? You had mentioned takeout-- is your intention to order and take the food back to the ship? Or is 'takeout' simply a style of Chinese food?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 05:29 AM
"Takeout was an attempt at traditional Chinese food meant to be fast and portable, it's now an entire genre of food all its own basically." Mera explained with a smile, it was a little complicated but she had full faith in Rekat's ability to understand it. "It's a little bit of a given but orange chicken is good no matter where, I often prefer the soy meat substitutes because of texture and my ability to maintain mobility after but it's still fantastic I think."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 05:34 AM
"Your... ability to maintain mobility?" He quirked a scaled brow quizzically. "I may regret asking this, but could you elaborate?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 05:39 AM
"I often feel lethargic after eating something very rich or heavy," Mera explained, gesturing emphatically, with the hand that wasn't holding Chaos, obviously. "So if I'm midshift or right before one, I don't tend to eat something I know is gonna affect me. But dinner? Dinner is no holds barred," She said, struck with a simple tinge of nostalgia for her brothers and their wrestle talk.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 05:41 AM
"Ah, so this Chinese food," he pronounced the word 'Chinese' with the softest hiss on the S, "It is very heavy, then? It sounds more and more like I'm going to enjoy it."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 05:51 AM
"I'm happy," Mera smiled. It had been a few minutes of walking to pass in about thirty seconds as far as Mera was concerned, but nevertheless they'd arrived at the restaurant. "Oh, amazing, we're here." She quickly passed over the menu, after they entered the establishment and waited for a table. "Alright, I think depending on your appetite we may be in a position to order a large. I'm an unfortunately large eater, blame the metabolism at the speed of light," Mera joked, "What about you?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 05:57 AM
Parlac was reading the menu with great interest. "This, er, 'sweet and sour chicken'-- it is a dessert item? But it is listed as an entree. And these 'egg rolls' do not appear to contain any egg-- but the 'egg drop soup' does contain egg? Are all the dishes served with rice? This dish says the beef is drunken, the animal is given alcohol or it is simply cooked in alcohol of some kind?" He paused and looked up at her over the top of his menu. "I apologize for my numerous questions."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 06:13 AM
"It's alright, I'll be honest, all I know is that it tastes good and not to question it per se, you know?" Mera waved the apology off as they sat down at a table. "Sweet things don't have to be desert, egg rolls have egg in the wrapper, yes most of the dishes are served with rice, the drunken things are typically consumed while drunk or hungover for best effect though it's not recommended you get plastered for the sake of food, though it may be tempting. It also refers too the dish being so spicy that one gets drunk trying to quell the capsaicin."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 06:21 AM
"Fascinating! Alright, well, I'd like to try a little bit of several dishes, would you be alright with multiple small plates to share rather than one large one?" The Cardassian was trying not to be overwhelmed by the sheer multitude of choices, but his stomach was grumbling and he wanted to taste whatever was the source of those delicious smells wafting from the table nearby. It was all almost enough to tear his mind way from the looming threat of a potential war, and he was resolved to enjoy himself as long as the eye of the hurricane lasted. (edited)
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 06:29 AM
"Totally fine by me." Mera smiled, she tapped a few things on the PADD menu, ensuring there'd be a hot pot, "Now, you just choose whichever other dishes you want to try by pressing their names and we'll be all set." She put the menu itself down and put her hands down on the table, they knitted together, allowing for a multitude of space for Chaos to roam.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 06:35 AM
Parlac was holding the PADD in one hand while Bedlam climbed through the fingers on his other, which meant a little bit of creative positioning to order: he brought the PADD up to his right hand and carefully pressed a few options, attempting to do so without disturbing Bedlam. "I would like to try one of these 'egg rolls' and some of this 'drunken beef' and... you mentioned the orange chicken was good, so we'll try that... and a cup of this 'egg drop soup' which I presume does not have anything to do with dropping eggs? At any rate, I'm eager to try everything!"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 05:39 PM
"I'm excited," Mera concurred, Chaos still traversing her hands and arms like a jungle gym. "So, uhh, tell me more about you?" Oh, classic El-Aurian deflection, Mera, fucks sake. She had a habit of just doing that, nobody really knew all that much about Mera, but she knew so much about other people. It was uncomfortable for her to talk about herself, really, it felt like a big to do and she only ever did it in interviews. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 06:07 PM
Oh dear, the 'talk about yourself' bit of socializing. Brows furrowed, he tried to think of what to say as he watched Bedlam make himself comfortable in his palm. "Er, well. I'm from Cardassia Prime, youngest of five brothers, bit of an orchid in the desert as far as my family is concerned. None of them were particularly thrilled with my choice to enter Starfleet. I, uh, I enjoy reading poetry, collecting alcohol from different cultures, and wrestling. I'm a confirmed old bachelor and likely to remain that way despite the best efforts of a certain science officer," he chuckled, "But it's a bit difficult to just come up with interesting things about me, I'm afraid I'm quite boring. If you have any questions, I would be happy to answer them."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 06:50 PM
“Sorry, I just have a habit of doing that.” Mera quickly apologized once he had finished. It was like an innate response to ask about people about themselves in conversation. “I’d certainly say the great knowledge about food and willingness to try more is interesting, at least to me. I’ve always been one for cuisine so I could just be the odd one out.” Mera chuckled.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 06:53 PM
"Oh, it's quite alright, I just don't want to bore anyone to death with my mundane existence," Parlac laughed quietly, "I don't mind the questions at all, just don't expect anything interesting to come of it. What about yourself? Tell me about your family, if you don't mind?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 07:57 PM
“Oh, me, um.” Mera took a second to collect her thoughts. “I’m the youngest of eight, I only have older brothers all of them in the fleet, our parents are okay with it, but uh everyone’s always surprised when they say they’re El-Aurian.” An awkward chuckle left her lips. “I’ve been ice skating since before I could walk, so uh, I don’t wanna say upwards of sixty years but uh, yeah.”
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 08:03 PM
[D] Several plates of assorted Chinese dishes were brought to the table, covering it in a spread of delicious smelling food. Parlac dug in almost immediately, grabbing a bowl of the egg drop soup and sipping at it between sentences. "My family is also all brothers! Though not quite so many as yours. It's an interesting dynamic, isn't it, to be the youngest of so many brothers? They can be... quite frustrating, at times, but you can't help but love them," A fond look crossed his face, tinged with sadness. "I miss them all, some... more than others. Ice skating, though! I've heard of it, but have no real knowledge of it-- Cardassia is much too warm for such things, and even when one of us travels somewhere that might be suitable for such an activity, we would be too uncomfortable with the cold to enjoy it, sadly. I would love to hear more about it! Do you have any holovids of yourself performing?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 08:46 PM
“It’s a little bit odd at times, but the wrestling practice helps on choice occasions.” Mera nodded to Rekat’s point, she missed her brothers dearly, and could tell from his face that he did too, at least a little, “I do, quite an embarrassing amount though I will say. They’re all on my PADD.” She patted the PADD itself softly, not wanting to just pull it up instantly.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 08:52 PM
"If you'd like to share, I'd love to see," he grinned, "Now, do you think you could help me use these, er, 'chohp stecks'?" His accented pronunciation remained slightly off from what it should sound like.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 09:46 PM
“Sure!” Mera smiled, tapping a few buttons on her PADD before sliding it over. It was a video of her in the academy, a practice day where she’d just finished learning a set, Mera was very proud if it to be fair, it was a piece she hadn’t really ever stopped skating since. It was a partner skate too, one of her closest friends actually. She missed the rush of the icy wind and the sound of her blades scraping the ice, the adrenaline and the way her toe picks anchored her to the ice. “Here, this is maybe my proudest.” (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 10:05 PM
He watched the vid with rapt attention, visibly fascinated by what was occurring. "Your movement is beautiful, so fluid and graceful! Your partner, as well. This is lovely. A much more appealing sport than what I participate in, I must say." As he spoke, he speared a piece of beef with one of the sticks and popped it in his mouth. He was reasonably confident that this wasn't how he was supposed to use the utensil, but he was hungry and this seemed effective.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 25-Dec-20 10:45 PM
"Thank you, I, I really miss skating like that on a regular basis, Donavan, my academy partner, is a rare sight more often than not," Mera laughed. "Oh, um, with the chopsticks, just uh, look at um, look at my hands." Mera demonstrated, holding one like a stylus before placing the other one where it was supposed to be. The sticks clicked together once, then twice, before holding a piece of meat.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 25-Dec-20 11:41 PM
"Is this something you can do in the holodeck or do you simply not have the time to practice as much as you'd like?" he asked, imitating her movement with the sticks. It was clearly awkward for him at first, and he kept dropping the food before it made it to his mouth. A frustrated pout appeared on his face. "Are you quite certain this is the correct method to use these?"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 02:13 AM
"It's a combination of the two actually," Mera nodded through a mouthful of food, covering it with her non dominant hand, luckily Chaos was now curled on her shoulder. "I don't have someone to do partnered things with, Don isn't posted on the Phoenix and neither is Nuran, my brother, we skated a lot together before adult life happened. I do go to the holodeck every once in a while to practice tho." Stars, Mera missed Menirsuro a lot sometimes. "Positive." Answered Mera lightly to Rekat's question with a little grin on her face. "It takes some getting used to, but with practice you'll be picking up individual grains of rice in no time." Rest assured that he would be, Mera turned her attention to the piece of now cooked meat she'd been dipping in the boiling broth.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 04:23 AM
"I understand that. I use the holodeck to practice wrestling occasionally but the computer generated opponent never feels the same as a real partner. Unfortunately, I can't afford to ignore my exercises," he chuckled. The Cardassian now turned his focus to the new utensils: After several more fruitless attempts, Parlac finally managed to get the hang of the chopsticks well enough to actually eat some of the orange chicken. He'd worked his way through tasting the beef, chicken, egg rolls, and egg drop soup. The food was entirely unfamiliar and yet delicious, which delighted him. Trying new food was always exciting but it wasn't always tasty-- this 'Chinese takeout' really was. The hot pot in the center of the table that Mera was removing a piece of meat from now claimed his attention. Did he dare attempt this maneuver using only chopsticks? "I don't suppose I'll be tossed out of restaurant unceremoniously if I drop the meat into the pot instead of successfully doing, well, that?" He gestured to her graceful manipulation of the utensils with his own.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 04:55 AM
"Oh no they won't, not at all." Mera shook her head vigorously to his question, "I like my meat rather on the raw side so I just dip, swish, and go, you can certainly drop it in and leave it be for a little bit." Encouragingly she gestured with her chopsticks from the meat being held to the broth and back a few times. There was something on Mera's mind, it had been a long time after all and she wanted to be sure. Was this what being friends was supposed to really be? Were they friends? This was an akward spot right? Right. It really was, but of course Mera wasn't about to say anything if Rekat didn't want to. Mera appeared to have spaced out for maybe a second and a half before snapping right back to attention.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 05:10 AM
Dutifully, he attempted to follow her advice, dipping and swishing the meat about in the boiling broth. It looked to be ready to slip away from him, but he managed to keep it pincered-- just barely. "Something on your mind, Lieutenant? Or have I finally bored you to tears?" He winked as he popped the piece of beef into his mouth. (edited)
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 05:30 AM
"Stars, no, you couldn't possibly." Mera, again, shook her head at Rekat's suggestion. "No, sometimes I just get horridly lost in thought I'm sorry." Mera neglected to mention anything that would kill the conversation by chance. The wink was welcome, very much so. To see that he was in a joking mood cheered Mera greatly.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 05:33 AM
"Oh don't be so sure! Get me rambling about classic Cardassian poets or the best way to pair bloodwine and you'll have immediate regrets, I can assure you!" He laughed and took a vegetable of some sort from the tray and into the boiling water for a quick swim before eating it. "I must thank you for your company this evening, I had expected to spend it alone in my quarters but instead I'm enjoying a whole new culture of food with an ice skating star. Genuinely, Lieutenant, I am having a lovely evening and I'm ever so grateful to you."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 06:03 AM
"I don't think I could get bored of that, not at all." Truly, it sounded interesting; she'd have loved to hear it. "Then I'm happy and the point of my evening has come to fruition. Really, I'm honored that you asked me out to dinner and let me show you something I'm familiar with." She closed her eyes and smiled briefly at the 'star skater' complement which had caught her somewhat off guard. She picked up the glass of wine that until now had been untouched and raised it lightly, "To a calm before a storm." Mera said solemnly, "And to finding solace in good food, and better company."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 06:32 AM
Ah, well, they'd made it quite far without touching on the war, but he should have known it would be at the forefront of everyone's mind. He raised the little cup of sake in a mirror of her toast and tried to smile properly, though he worried it might come across as more of a grimace. "I'll drink to that, absolutely." There were few things in life that put him at ease as much as good company, good food, and a little taste of alcohol. Despite the reminder of the looming threat of the Iconians, Parlac felt quite comfortable.
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 07:45 PM
She could only have gone so long without it crossing her mind, and with her proclivity for genuinely panicking at least a little over things she could not control, it was a miracle she made it this far. After the sip of wine, Mera sucked her teeth at the taste, it wasn't too bad at all, a little sour if anything. Sensing she'd murdered the conversation in cold blood, Mera swapped the topic of conversation to something far more pleasant in nature. "So how long have you been a poet?"
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 07:53 PM
He chuckled lightly. "I certainly wouldn't call myself a poet by any stretch of the imagination. I love and enjoy poetry, but writing it myself, well. Let's just say I don't typically share my writing." More of the drunken beef had found its way into his mouth, and he knocked back another shot of sake. "But I have enjoyed poetry for as long as I can remember. Cardassian culture emphasizes that children be brought up to appreciate art in all its forms, and I took to poetry more easily than to anything else. From there, it was easy enough to start reading and learning poetry from other cultures. I particularly enjoy Terran poetry, and not that I would admit it to my family but I find the subjects of Earth poems more enjoyable than the constant theme of devotion to the state that permeates most Cardassian ones."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 08:26 PM
"Oh that's interesting," Mera grinned, it really was, at least to her. "In my culture," She started, actually comfortable with the person she was talking to enough to open up "We're taught more to listen than share so anything we come across, we appreciate and learn. It's a crude way of describing it, but as often said, El-Aurians are a race of listeners, I guess. We have things of our own, but often people think it's odd, y'know? Nevertheless, I adore immersing myself in other cultures. When I was stationed at Deep Space Nine, I consumed a truly staggering number of Hasperats and managed to garner a recipe from a cook in Jalanda that I use whenever I find fresh ingredients. A Vulcan commander aboard the USS Demeter, my first posting, actually gave me a jar of Redspice that unfortunately I finished far too fast but I do replenish my supply whenever I find myself near Vulcan. I'm so sorry I'm rambling on." Mera laughed with an embarrassed look on her face and a hand over her mouth. (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 08:38 PM
"If that's rambling, I don't want to know what you'd call my monologues!" The Chief laughed with her, "But it's pleasant to meet someone else so fascinated with other cultures. I find many races tend to be incredibly insular, though not all of them are quite as bad as the Cardassians, even subtle insulation can keep you from learning new things. I hope to never stop learning as long as I am able to do so." He paused to check on Bedlam's comfort, the tiny snake now curled up just inside the left sleeve of his uniform. Careful not to move him, Parlac reached for another egg roll and took a bite out of it, humming contentedly as he enjoyed the new flavors. "I must admit, as much as I love eating various foods from various cultures, I'm not much of a cook myself. It sounds like that's something you can do quite well though, if you've mastered hasperat!"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 09:24 PM
"I owe all of that to the owner of the restaurant, it's his own family recipe. All I have to do is follow instructions, plus, I had a good ten years to make sure I got the technical aspect right." Mera chuckled bashfully, suddenly reminded of the fact that she was seventy years old. "I think it might be that most of the time I just shut up which leads people to blurt things out. I think that might just be me, but I'm comfortable I guess if I'm just spilling everything out like this."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 09:52 PM
"I appreciate your willingness to share, Lieutenant." He was smiling but there was something serious around his eyes. "I have often struggled to make acquaintances into friends, finding it easier instead to spend all of my time at work or alone. I wish to impress upon you... how grateful I am that you have allowed me to get to know you and that you are comfortable enough around me to share your thoughts freely. With everything else going on right now, well, this has been very nice." He looked down to where Bedlam had poked his head out from his cuff. "And of course, I am delighted to have met these lovely creatures as well."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 10:31 PM
"Thank you for giving me an opportunity to speak freely and comfortably." A sense of deep seated universal dread made itself at home inside Mera's body, permeating to her extremities and resonating in her core. It was like someone had kicked her straight in the chest and kept their foot there. She shook the feeling off, it could certainly wait for later in her quarters or in the holodeck with a pair of skates. Yes, that was what she could do. "I'm happy you enjoyed this so much, the dinner, the food, the snakes."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 10:56 PM
"Would you like to wrap up and head back to the ship?" He was leaning back in his chair now, content and very full, and still feeling the buzz of the sake. It seemed like Mera had something on her mind, but he didn't want to press her if she didn't want to talk about it. "We have made quite a dent in all this food, I'd say!"
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 11:34 PM
"Only if you want to," Mera smiled, belittling any sense of fear she had in favor of staying and not making anyone uncomfortable. She took another larger sip of the wine on the table, swirling it around in the glass before putting it back down again. "We could have this packed up and bring it back to the ship." (edited)
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 11:38 PM
"That sounds like a splendid idea. As much as I'd love to simply stay and eat and drink into the wee hours of the morning, I'm afraid my age-- as a Cardassian of course," he emphasized his race, knowing Mera had him soundly beaten in the age department, "prevents me from staying out quite as late anymore."
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 26-Dec-20 11:45 PM
"Oh trust me, I'm no party animal, I need my sleep." Mera laughed, "I'd be happy to do this again sometime, it was a much needed break I must say. I hope you don't mind me saying, but you're very good at exuding calm and friendliness." Mera admitted, truthfully, of course. As they packed up, Mera made sure she had both her snakes, and an equal half of the leftovers before rising from her seat, "Have a good night Parlac, and while we're off duty, it's totally alright to call me Mera."
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 26-Dec-20 11:50 PM
"I'm happy to walk you back, if you don't mind. Since we're headed in the same direction and all." He didn't say anything in response to her compliment but he was visibly pleased nonetheless: a very light flush of blue was evident on his forehead and neck. "And I'll try to remember about the name, I do tend to be overly formal." (edited)
Lieutenant Mera Aeonian 27-Dec-20 12:00 AM
"I don't mind," Mera grinned, not expecting him to offer, "Not at all. And no need to worry about the name, it's just if you want to." She was happy to be walked back, making silent plans to skate some time soon, having been inspired to do it sometime after watching a performance again. She payed the flush no mind, she would've done the same in his situation, truly.
Lt. Cmdr. Rekat Parlac 27-Dec-20 12:08 AM
He stood and followed her out of the restaurant, full, happy, lightly buzzed, and ready for sleep.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 12:41 AM
Queueing was a chore - but whatever, it was a fact of life and he would put up with it. Except the restaurant queue stretched on for... miles. Not really, but it snaked round half the hallway and that was saying something. He nonetheless stood in line, waiting to be let in. (edited)
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 12:43 AM
Cas's eyes widened slightly as she followed him. "Wow, this is... a very long line." It was a bit of an understatement. "Maybe we should go somewhere else."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 12:44 AM
"THere's the Japanese restaurant a few doors down. No queue." He nodded to the somewhat empty shop down the hallway.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 12:46 AM
"Sounds good." She said, then added: "And not to mention a lot quieter."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 12:50 AM
That settled it, then. He broke off from the ridiculously long queue and made for that establishment instead. Besides, they didn't have all day (or likely all life) to waste. Having gotten in with absolutely no hassle he found them a table. "I've... tried a few thigns on this menu before. By myself..."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 01:01 AM
The restaurant was a nice place- quiet, but it had a warm atmosphere. A few patrons dotted the tables. "Well, I don't have much experience with Japanese food myself, but I'm sure there's something good- I'll take your word for it." She said, following him to the table he chose. She sat down in the chair across from Ramat. "So... have you spent a lot of time on spacedock or do you just happen to be a restaurant guru?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 01:12 AM
"Neither. My classmates at Starfleet Academy dragged me here." He replied. "The actors' club. It was... an experience."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 01:16 AM
"Woah- you were in the actors' club?" That was a bit of surprising knowledge she was not expecting. "Somehow that doesn't, uh... seem like you."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Dec-20 01:21 AM
[Ramat]"It isn't. It turns out that our cinder block props made better actors than me," He seemed rather nonchalant about that somehow. Ha. "Anything look interesting to you? On the menu I mean." (edited)
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 01:29 AM
Cas chuckled. "I can't say I would do much better- I'm not exactly an arts person." She looked down at the menu. "Um... the shoyu ramen looks nice. Have you found anything?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 01:51 AM
"Katsu curry rice. I find it pretty pleasant. Not that the Dominion ever fed us too well." He mutterd flatly.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 02:24 AM
"Sounds good." Part of her wanted to prod the Dominion subject, but there wasn't much she could think of to say. "So how was your time at the Academy? Were you involved with anything, or only the... theatrical arts?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Dec-20 02:26 AM
[Ramat]"Boxing. Mixed martial arts. Even tried out the chess club once. I was thrown out of the first two after I sent six people to the Academy infirmary."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 02:43 AM
"Oh... um, wow. I never took many combat classes or anything while I was there. I was more of a runner. Though, in hindsight, it might've been useful to focus a bit more on fight along with the flight." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Dec-20 02:57 AM
[Ramat]"Athletics?" She looked the part, he thought. Definitely looked the part.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 03:05 AM
Cas nodded. "Yep. You're looking at the most recent winner of the Academy marathon, in fact."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Dec-20 03:08 AM
[Ramat]Oh. Oh my. He instantly sat up in his seat, nodding to the waiter that brought them their orders for the night. "Interesting. I salute you, Cas. That is an achievement indeed."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 03:16 AM
She looked down at her plate, pleased at how delicious it looked. "Thank you. It took quite a lot of training at the time, though- not so sure I could win now." She picked up a utensil and gestured to their food. "This looks very good!"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 03:24 AM
"Something I've learned about myself - and of any other as well." He dug into his order of curry rice and smiled softly. Mmm. Just as he remembered. "We stay ourselves somehow. Always. You have it in you somewhere. Why don't you do a run and see?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 03:38 AM
Cas smiled. This was nice- she liked talking with Ramat. He was good company. "Oh, I do, just not as much as I used to. I have a couple holodeck programs I like to use, and I know the Phoenix has a gym, so maybe I'll go for one soon."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 03:41 AM
"You'll do perfectly fine. Go have a run tomorrow or something, I don't know. You'll run laps round the deck past even me." Then he cracked the faintest hint of a smile. Just a hint, nothing else.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 03:51 AM
She swallowed a mouthful of noodles and matched his smile. "I think you've convinced me. I'll let you know if I manage to match my time."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 03:52 AM
"I'll wait for your answer, then. You will be fine." He answered. "Maybe if ever need be you'll be able to run rings around me, and I will never catch you. Even if I need to kill you for whatever reason." (edited)
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 03:58 AM
"Well, lets hope it never comes to that." She said, stirring her food. "I'd get tired eventually, and I don't think I could fend you off for very long."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 04:03 AM
"Well, no. You cannot. Especially if I need to drag you back to sickbay for treatment." *He gave her a half smile. He'd had to do it before to a pair of unruly Klingon crewmen. Hypo-ed both, dragged them back on his shoulders he did. Ho ho. That was fun.*
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 04:08 AM
"I'll keep that in mind next time I have the fleeting though of avoiding sickbay. You'll be the little angel on my shoulder telling me what I should be doing." She said, laughing lightly. There was a slight lull, and she used to swallow another bite of food. "So, spekaing of sickbay, what have you been up to lately?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 04:25 AM
Yes, Ramat, what have you been up to, hmm? He sighed a little and went on with dinner, albeit a bit more slowly. The guilt in his expression shone through. "Nothing much. I brought two colleagues on a field training scenario. I... it didn't go as planned. I traumatized one, I think, and the other yelled at me for being too harsh. Which I was being."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 04:37 AM
Cas frowned slightly. "Oh. I'm sure- well, I'm sure they won't hold it against you forever. Especially if you've apologized- which I assume you have. It takes a lot to hold a grudge." She paused, considering whether to go forward with her next line of questioning, but figured it was better now than never. "Actually, I was going to ask someone from medical for some basic training just to... have. To be prepared. If you'd be up for another training scenario?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Dec-20 05:14 AM
[Ramat]He was silent for another few minutes, making no noise save chewing of course. Eventually he did answer, hollowly: "No. Not yet. Lest I forget who I am training again..."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 05:21 AM
"That's alright." She answered. And it was- she didn't want to push him into something he was uncomfortable with, and there was probably already a holodeck training program she could use. "And- it's okay to feel guilty, but don't forget to forgive yourself at some point. You might've made a mistake, but it wasn't coming from a bad place."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 06:09 AM
"Yes. It was not. I'll apologize to the two of them later." He answered, surprisingly softer than should have bene possible (or expected) for one of his species.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 06:14 AM
A soft smile spread across Cas' face. "I'm glad to hear it." She replied. "Has medical been doing a lot of extra training lately, or was the simulation a special request?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 06:28 AM
"It was a special request by both of them. They wanted combat medic training." He noted. "Except... I threw them into more than they could handle."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 06:32 AM
She gave him a reassuring look. "It's okay, Ramat. I wasn't prodding more into that." She spun up a bit of her noodles. "I was more curious about the first half of the question. I walked in a conversation with a few other officers the other day, and they were dicussing tactical drills, so I was more wondering if any other divisions were doing the same."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 06:34 AM
"Medical isn't. But it would do us good ot have some I think. I'll let you know when we start, if we start. How does that sound."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 06:39 AM
"Sounds good." She said. She looked down at her food, noticing it was almost gone, but she didn't say anything to acknowledge it. She let the pause draw out- if Ramat wanted to end the meal he could, but she was enjoying herself. Not that she had anything else to add at the moment- but it was nice nevertheless.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 06:50 AM
"In the meantime... we have the night here on Spacedock and I don't think I want to waste it. Is there anywhere you'd like to visit while you're here?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 07:05 AM
"Well, you should know I'm not very good at making decisions." Cas admitted, laying her utensils on her plate and crossing her hands. "Though I've heard the arboretum is quite nice, and I'm sure there are some other nice places on the promenade. Either is fine with me!"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 07:14 AM
"Somewhere quiet then. The arboretum, assuming it's not too crowded this time of night. How's that sound?" It sounded nice. No disturbances, just a normal chat.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Dec-20 07:17 AM
"Sounds perfect." She said, standing up from the table.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Dec-20 07:20 AM
Just as well. He returned his bowl and headed out of the restaurant with her.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 02:10 AM
Now on the promenade, Sara whipped out her PADD and waited to be messaged.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 02:37 AM
He galloped in walking over to sara who was in the promenade. "Sara!" He hollered, waving his hand.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 02:52 AM
Hearing a familiar voice, she turned to face Khil and gave an ecstatic wave. "Hallo Khil! Good to see you again, thank for inviting me out! How's your day been?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 03:02 AM
"My day has been perfect! I am feeling stronger, more enlightened, and full of wisdom. I feel old" He said, sitting down infront of her, a smile growing bigger onto his face.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 03:03 AM
"Oh wow! That is a good day, anything happen? Did you have a one on one with Amanda or something?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 03:04 AM
"Well lets just say, I saw your little cherubs grow into a new.... uh, flower, or whatever the term is for flowers to uh... bloom." He said, looking confused as to why he just said those words so weirdly.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 03:06 AM
"You.. saw my flower buds bloom? You mean my Ensigns?" She asked curiously, tilting her head to the side slightly. She certainly hoped that was the case, that'd sound a little weird otherwise.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 03:09 AM
"Yeah your Ensigns, well... not Ensigns anymore. I also saw a couple other people do the same exact thing. It was a very warm experience." He said, smiling, hoping that she would eventually catch on.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 03:13 AM
"Oh my gosh! Who else got promoted?? I know Lithop and T'lith, and I knew other people did but I didn't get any names!" Excited hands flung to her lips to cover her mouth as she spoke in a thrilled tone.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 03:16 AM
"I wonder, Well lets see, there were two black uniforms, a couple lighter blue ones. The Security cheif, and two darker yellow uniforms." He said, lifing up his head to unfold the collar that hid the pip, hopefully she would be able to catch on now.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 03:18 AM
A light went off and it finally clicked. She gasped softly and gave a quick squeal, immediately wrapping her arms around her friend in a hug. "Oh my god you got promoted too duh!! I'm so dumb!! Congrats Khil I am so proud of you!!"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 03:22 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 03:23 AM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 03:56 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 04:06 AM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 04:08 AM
"Yeah, but I bet people had stuff to do and people to you know, brag to haha." He said rubbing the back of his neck. "What do you think we should get to eat?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 04:14 AM
"You're the promotion boy! You should choose, yes? I do not have a very discriminating pallette, though I don't tolerate a lot of accute malice in the form of spicy." (edited)
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 04:17 AM
"Hm, well. Lets see, have you ever had uh... Brosket, or, Bresket.... Brixit?" He said, these english terminations for different types of food, always confused him.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 04:30 AM
"Brisket? Like barbeque?" She answered in response with a chuckle, nodding her head in the affirmative. "I have- not in a long time though. Up until a few months ago I was a vegetarian."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 04:35 AM
"Ooh, my bestie is a veggie queen. I like what im hearing, Im a vegetarian too, and I heard that they were serving vegetarian brisket here, which sounds... weird. Doesnt that stuff like, have to smoke in like a chamber or something for hours so that it breaks apart?" He asked.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 04:42 AM
"Oh I have no idea, I'm not a vegetarian anymore my iron stayed too low. But there's a lot of great veggie stuff now a days, I'm sure veggie brisket is like, totally yum. Have you ever had carrot salmon? I know, sounds weird, but it's actually pretty comparable- and Norwegians are salmon experts."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 04:44 AM
"I wouldnt be living if i hadn't tried it. Its absolutely, one of the best dishes i've had since my first time on earth." He said, going through and ordering the brisket.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 04:46 AM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 04:48 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 05:04 AM
"Oh yeah! I love that stuff, I taught myself how to make it when I was still an ensign. Gosh my poor roommate, the smell of fish sauce hung in the air for a whole day." Taking her tray, she nodded her head towards a nearby table and sat down, crossing one leg over the other politely. "So what's the first thing you're gonna do on the job as lieutenant?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 05:05 AM
"Well, I feel like im going to start off with putting up that security system in the jefferies tubes. I pitched the idea to the commander and she said that she liked it. So im good to go in the new year eventually." He said, sitting down with her and taking a sip of his drink.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 05:13 AM

I went to inspect during a cleaning run and found food debris. One time I found a blanket." He said, chuckling.

Is it a one man job or are you going to need a team?" (edited)

Got a lot of great books."

"He told me he used to be a cook on a freighter for a few months, but I didn't think it bled over into sweets..but then again I've never been on a freighter, so what would I know." Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 08:01 PM
"Oh definitely- He's a very good engineer despite being a little awkward socially. Not that I'm telling you to- but he's darn good at what he does. If you get the opportunity to work with him, I would take it." She gleaned a smile, taking the last bite of her food as well. It was a small portion, but it was enough to keep her going until dinner, definitely. She sipped at her lemonade quietly for a few moments as the conversation shifted. "Oh hey, that means you're getting moved to lieutenant quarters, yeah?" (edited)
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 08:03 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 08:09 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 08:14 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 08:18 PM
"Oh, Binky usually stays in the washroom. That snake was used for something else and was holographic, do not worry. I only have one pet, and hes my everything. A rescue cat." He said, pulling out his PADD and showing a picutre of Binky.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 08:24 PM
Sara looked over curiously, moving a bit of her bangs out of the way to see properly. "Wow! That is a very naked cat!" She announced, maybe a tad too loud as some Andorians looked over to them with a glare. She however paid it no mind, amazed at the cat. "Why's he bald, is he an old man or does he have a condition?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 08:27 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 01-Jan-21 08:28 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 08:31 PM
"He feels soft, like if someone were to gently rub someones shoulder, or arm... minus the hair of course. And he has multiple sweaters. Basically he has his own wardrobe." He said, putting on a happy face. (edited)

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 09:12 PM

Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 01-Jan-21 09:44 PM

Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 12:00 AM
Oskar exited the airlock and began looking around for Sara. Look for a short woman with blonde hair. Not too hard with his height.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 12:01 AM
She noticed him immediately. There weren't many people here that stood out like a light pole. Waving him down, she gave a smile as she walked over. "You walked quick!! What'd that take you, six steps?~" (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 12:07 AM
“Five, actually. Jefferies tube door was across from the airlock.” Oskar said, laughing a little. “So, how have you been? Haven’t seen you since last rank.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 12:09 AM
"Well as I can, I was just about to do some creature comforts shopping before I got the news it was you who'd also gotten promoted. I got all the juicy gossip from Khil."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 12:13 AM
“Ah. Yeah, I didn’t know I was going to get promoted. I feel like a new man with two solid rank bars now. Feels pretty good, not gonna lie.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 12:14 AM
"Looks very good on you! Would it be too mushy for me to take a picture?" She took her PADD out of her skirt pocket and gave it a quick wave, as if tantalizing him into giving into her sentimentality.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 12:17 AM
“Go ahead. It’ll be a good holo photo for my Captains photo reel.” Oskar said, posing up on the nearby wall. “Make sure to get my good side, ja?” (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 12:20 AM
"I like your left side best. You have nicer waves in your hair there. Smile!" She grinned as well and took two pictures in quick succession, pulling her PADD in close to look at them, making sure she hadn't blurred them. "Want me to send them to you?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 12:55 AM
“Sure. I’ll add them to my Phoenix photo album. I have a few from almost every mission and major event.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 01:10 AM
"Take one with me too, please?" She asked, still texting the pictures to his PADD, but looked up to him in order to ask.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 01:48 AM
“Sure. You want me to use my arm to get both of us in frame?” He asked, if she took the photo not all of either one of them would appear in the frame.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 01:51 AM
"I'm not that short!!" She cried indignantly, flipping the camera forward and stepping next to him holding the PADD out and giving a quick smile before realizing.. It did only get her face and most of his chest. She frowned deeply at the realization, wanting to glare but somehow stifling it. God he was so annoying when he was right. "But you do take better pictures.." She copped out, handing the PADD to him almost shamefully. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 02:08 AM
“I thought so.” Oskar said and took and PADD and oriented the camera the right way. He gave a smile to the camera and waited for her to get ready.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 02:25 AM
Sticking out her tongue to him, she quickly righted her face and gave a smile for the camera, holding up a peace sign, as was her usual picture-taking pose.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 02:39 AM
Oskar took a couple pictures with the camera and returned to his regular posture and handed her the PADD back.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 02:41 AM
"Thank you!~ These will be fun to look back on one day when you're a lieutenant commander, huh?" She grinned, pocketing the PADD and nudging him to guide him towards the promenade walkway proper. "Wait you said Captain reel?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 02:50 AM
Oskar followed, slowing himself down to keep pace with Sara. “Yes. I intend to be a Captain one day, maybe even have my own ship. If I stay Intelligence maybe they’ll let me captain one of the new intel cruisers.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 02:52 AM
"That's really a lot of pressure, don't you think? Gosh, Captain. I'd be so proud for you but I would worry- you've seen what happens to the Captains around here, right?" She asked, looking a little morose at the thought of anything happening to her friend.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 03:20 AM
“I think I’d be up for the challenge. I’ve seen how fast Captains go around here and I think I’m ready for that. What? You don’t see yourself being Captain?”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 03:31 AM
"Wh- I mean. I guess we all consider it at some point.. Maybe Commander.. I'm not so sure I'd be a great Captain. I'm a bit awkward at giving commands, but I'm a very good obeyer though." She huffed a quick laugh and a half smile. She'd been complimented by A'aehrel and asked if she'd considered command by her.. but it seemed like such a wild dream to be anywhere except science. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 04:23 AM
“Well I think you’d be a great Captain. Even an Admiral too. Just gotta work on your command voice.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 04:29 AM
"I think you'd make a better one.~ What do you think about Admiral, would you ever wanna go that high or do you wanna be in the midst of it until you retire?" (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 04:41 AM
“I think I’d like to stay down with the people rather than look at battle boards. Admirals get many more migraines as a result of looking at those things you know.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 05:00 AM
"I dunno, I dunno Admiral König has a ring to it, a certain je nais se qua even! You never how you might feel when you're older." Walking near a random store that sold a few comfort items, she guided her friend into it, seeing as they has no place in particular to go. "It might be a while before we're at ESD again, just wanted a few things that aren't as easily replicatable."

Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 05:26 AM
“Yeah, seems like a good idea. Some of the good items you can’t really get on ship.” Oskar followed her into the shop.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 05:39 AM
