I imagine not shop for soy candles." She laughed, smelling one lightly and holding it up for him to smell as well. The scent was almost tangy- some sort of lemon-berry scent.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 05:54 AM
“Actually, a shopping trip is probably what I need. No long night of drinking for me tonight.” Oskar said and picked up a candle as well. This one smelled of citrus and cream. “How are you and Tal and Gibs doing?” (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 06:21 AM
"We.. agreed that we made better friends." She finally admitted, quietly. "We're both okay, it was mutual. Though.. not sure what to do about gibs.. technically we co-own him, But I have the bigger room. But Tal is so in love with that cat I dunno if I could bring myself to take him." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 06:43 AM
Oskar looked down and walked over to her. “Oh. I’m sorry it didn’t work out between you guys. Looks like now you’ll have to have a custody hearing for Gibs. Someone gets him on weekdays and the other gets weekends, hm?”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 06:52 AM
"It'll be alright, the important part is that we stayed friends. I thought a round two break up might do it in but! I guess we're both just forgiving souls. But.. more than likely Tal will get Gibs. Realistically he has less shifts and more time than I do. And while I like cats, and I do love Gibs.. Tal really. Ugh you don't understand, I've never seen him so sweet and mushy before.. I think he needs him. " (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 06:57 AM
“Well, as long as you’re both not hating each other. I can tell you that that part always hurts.” A slight pause. “But if Tal wants Gibs, then I think he’ll be a happy cat with him. I actually gave up Archimedes a couple days ago. A cousin of mine wanted a bird and I felt that Archimedes wasn’t safe aboard the ship anymore. He’s a little bird, a hearty one but still little.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 06:58 AM
"Oh no! Oh Oskar you poor thing, I didn't even know you gave him up!? Why do you think he is not safe? He has survived up till now, yes? Despite it all."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:02 AM
Oskar shrugged. “With the attack we sustained a while back, we were nearly cooked alive. I had to nurse Archimedes back to flying shape for three days. Besides, he’s going to a place where he has much more space. I’m sure he’s gotten tired of seeing the same four walls of my quarters every day.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:10 AM
"I- yeah.. I see what you mean. It was terrifying for all of us.. but especially for an animal that doesn't understand. But even so-" She gave him a soft pat on the arm sympathetically before taking the offered candle and smelling it. "I'm sorry. Not a great way to begin the new year in some ways, ja?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:14 AM
“Yeah. Sometimes things don’t work out like they should.” Oskar gave a soft smile when she patted his arm. He picked up a bottle of lotion from a shelf and opened the top, smelling it. “I’ve been thinking about using some lotion after sonic showers. My arm keeps getting itchy.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:22 AM
"Maybe you're dehydrated, if you're not drinking enough water, when the Sonic shower lifts the dead skin off of you and you're not hydrated, the new skin beneath can get irritated." She too moved over to the lotions, picking up a pink one, smelling it curiously as she spoke. "Those milk and honey moisturizers really do work if you want to make it in your quarters- but they probably have something similar here too. Ohh, oatmeal too helps." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:29 AM
“Uh...what about this one?” He set the one he picked up back down and got a new one, smelling it curiously. He looked at the label. “Cocoa and mint. Doesn’t smell to bad either, actually.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:37 AM
"No doubt smells good- but do you really wanna put mint on irritated skin, Oskar? Ich bin mir nicht sicher, ob du so anders gebaut bist."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:44 AM
“Sie tun so, als wüsste ich etwas über Hautpflege, Sara.” Oskar said and closed the top of the lotion and kept looking.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:50 AM
"What's your favorite smell? Maybe we could find it with something that'll actually help your skin irritation. I am, after all, body care queen you know. " She flipped open a cap that held something orange-citrus based before shaking her head and setting it back down after closing the lid. "Citrus might burn you as well." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:53 AM
“I like sandalwood and incense. But I haven’t really had the time to meditate on incense yet. Part of me is afraid I’ll set off the fire system.” Oskar said and grabbed another bottle. This one smelled of apple and berries. “This some smells nice.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 03:22 PM
"I thought for sure you were gonna say pine or something. Perhaps an oil diffuser instead? I know it doesn't have the same ambiance as incense, but it doesn't have the fire or smoke element that gets you in trouble. I have two, you could have my other one? Or maybe we could find you a pretty one here?" She leaned over to smell the apple-berry lotion, nodding approvingly after a moment. "Ohh, that is nice. Kinda reminds me of this one cocktail I had in academy, you know? Ripple berry mango.. something."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:04 PM
“I’m just gonna pretend I know that that drink is.” Oskar said and sniffed the lotion again. “Yeah, maybe an oil diffuser doesn’t sound too bad. Think I might get this lotion too just for the fact it smells nice.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:18 PM
"Careful, you're gonna have half the crew pressed up on you trying to get a nose full with you smelling like a sugary smoothie. She warned. She hoped most of the crew had better sense than to do so to an officer, but who knew anymore. "But you wanna get one here? The oil diffuser I mean. It's around the holidays- I'm sure they have some pretty ones we can find, yes?" (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:22 PM
“Sure. You’d probably know what to look for, anyway. I’m just lost in all this stuff. Seems like they all do the same thing then it turns out mint and citrus will hurt.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:32 PM
"See- you don't want anything that has a citric acid- though in retrospect, mint might actually help depending on how strong it is.. might just sting a bit. Lift your sleeve for me?" She asked, picking back up the chocolate mint lotion he'd had moments ago. Oh, it was a tester, good. She squeezed a bit out and held out her fingers to him, waiting for him to pull his sleeve up.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:35 PM
“Oh, yeah sure.” Oskar said and rolled up his left sleeve and held his arm for her. There were small red lines on his arm from where he would scratch it. “See? This is why I ask you about these types of things.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:39 PM
"Surely I'm not your only friend who actually moisturizes, Oskar." She quipped back smartly, giving him a smile as she smeared the lotion on and rubbed it in. It smelt like chocolate mint pie, though thankfully it was more chocolate than mint. "How's it feel? Burning? Itchy? Fine?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 07:42 PM
“You’re the only one I know moisturizes, there.” Oskar smiled as well, watching her apply the lotion. “Feels like the muscle relaxing stuff I use. Doesn’t really burn or sting.” He said, sniffing the air. Certainly made him smell good.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 07:56 PM
"I bet Giles does." She snorted quickly, she honestly had no idea if his boss did or not, but it was still a funny thought. "Well it does smell awfully nice, and if it's not irritating you and makes you feel good, maybe you should snag this one and we'll go find you a diffuser?" She pointed towards the back where several dozen glowing, lamp like apparatuses sat, the smell coming from them mingling in the air between sweet and home nostalgia. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 08:08 PM
“Sure. Guide me through the machines, Sensei.” Oskar said jokingly, closing the bottle he had in his hands and got one of the ones he could actually take. He followed Sara.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 08:15 PM
Sighing and shaking her head, she guided him towards the back of the store to find an appropriate diffuser. The variety was great, but truth be told, she didn't really know Oskar's aesthetic outside of 'black' and 'action movie'. "So what colors do you like?" (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 08:37 PM
“Uh...black. Crimson too, if my ball outfit was anything to go by, huh?” Oskar said and looked through the diffusers. He had no idea what any of them did.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 08:44 PM
"I loved your ball outfit! I thought they were family colors because you were wearing your dueling cape, but I guess not? Do the old families even do colors anymore or is it just a lost practice now?" She fingered over a few of the diffusers as she spoke, delighting in one that was blowing bubbles of the oil-filtered water, but that would surely make a mess- oil spatters. Might have made a nice bathroom one though. "So a simple one perhaps? One that just..does The Function and gives you The Smell Good, yes?" (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 08:55 PM
“Yes they are family colors. Actually, the families on Saladin II still do crests and colors. Oma says it’s to anchor us to our past. I believe her about that one.” Oskar looked over at her. “Yeah, that seems more up my alley.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 09:04 PM
"Hee!~ Your colors are opposite to mine. Maybe we should have a blood feud about it, gross, terrible König crimson bastards, the lot of you." She chuckled, but she wished she was joking- that really was how easy it was to start a family war back in ye olden days- insulting someone's colors or crests. History sure was fun and humanity was surely not a species that was meant to have lived this long. "How about this one? It's only got three buttons and it changes color." She pointed out a small balloon-shaped one that was emitting a cotton-candy smell currently, but the color was a soft, pastel green, though it was slowly morphing to blue. "Easy enough?" (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 09:55 PM
“You Bjørges and your bright blue colors. See you coming from two hundred yards away.” Oskar joked, looking at the diffuser she had pointed out. He studied it for a moment. “Sounds like something I can get my ape brain around.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 09:59 PM
"Ah it's a trap though, you won't see the rest of us coming two hundred yards from behind you. We're a sneaky bunch. Ohhh, look it does turn grey! Not black, but grey! Like a..it's a little angry cloud!!" She nearly squealed as she clicked the color button, turning it to it's final color, a silver-grey that did, in fact, make it look like a sad, grumpy fat cloud. "Oskarrrrr, you gotta get the sad fat cloud diffuser." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 10:04 PM
Oskar laughed a little as they both watched the diffuser switch around. “Alright. Grumpy cloud diffuser it is. Actually is does look like a sad cloud.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 10:15 PM
"It's biggest grump. Very pout. This would make such a good ambiance to like, those rain noises, you know? Gosh that knocks me out like a bat to the head- does it you? The rain, I mean?" She questioned, looking down beneath the display and grabbing an unopened box and handing it to Oskar.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 11:07 PM
“I like the wind and old wooden ship noises, myself. Creaks in the wood, people walking about above deck. I’m out like a baby in twenty minutes flat.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 11:15 PM
"Oh, so waking up every 30 minutes in a fit?" She teased with a grin, starting to head out towards check out, but a display of bath soaks caught her eyes as she childishly wriggled her fingers in a test bowl. "Why does that put you out? The sound of people walking would absolutely wake me up! No judgment, just curious."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 11:19 PM
“I dunno. Something about rhythm like that just knocks me out. Besides, it’s not like they’re stomping around. Just soft footfalls and soft conversations.” Oskar followed her to the bath soaks. “What exactly do these do?”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 11:23 PM
"They make your skin very soft and supple, heavy duty moisturizers-" She pointed to a pink one. " Detoxifiers." She pointed to a yellow one. "And some just have very long lasting perfumes." She pointed to a blue one. " They all do different stuff, some have more than others, but I'm really just about taking good care of my skin- so I usually get the moisturizer and the detoxifiers. It just so happens that they smell really nice too, and don't get me started on hair product. "
Commander Yllescas Itesh 02-Jan-21 11:26 PM
“Uh huh. Hair product. Right.” Oskar was confused about all this stuff. As far as he was concerned, hair care was running it though a little water and shampooing it every now and again.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 02-Jan-21 11:28 PM
"You have very short hair, you wouldn't understand. When your hair is long, it tangles more easily, it gets dryer easier, I have curly hair, but the air on the spaceship makes my curls limp. Some of the hair product offsets the damage that space does to human hair." She explained, trying so, so hard to not sound like a snob. She truly wasn't! She just had a lot of hair.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 03-Jan-21 12:01 AM
“Well I also have a beard. I just comb it and put some beard oil in it every so often. Maybe run some water through it if it gets itchy. Seems to work well enough until I have to shave it again.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Jan-21 12:24 AM
"Why'd you start wearing a beard, by the way? You used to be clean shaven all the time. It doesn't look bad, but it is a change I've noticed." She thought for a minute about reaching up and grabbing a finger full of it, but thought against it. "The beard oil does smell really nice though." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 03-Jan-21 12:35 AM
“Well, I had thought about growing out while I was with Momo. She liked it better as clean shaven, so I stayed with the clean face. Then she left and I had free reign over it, so I decided to grow it out.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Jan-21 01:15 AM
"It is technically more hygienic that way if you're with someone, but I get it. How long do you think you'll grow it?" Taking two bags of pink, and two yellow, she headed up to the counter finally for them to check off the inventory and bag their items. "It makes you look more mature than you are~"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 03-Jan-21 01:33 AM
“This length is long enough. Half a centimeter more and I can’t stop scratching it.” Oskar put his items in the counter and looked down at her. “A couple added years for a beard? I think I’ll take it.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Jan-21 01:47 AM
"It makes you look in your thirties. But, I suppose if that is a thing you want I certainly won't try to convince you otherwise. Maybe when you start dating again you can get single girls on the ship to sit on your lap and ask what they want for Christmas!" She couldn't help it, she snorted out a bit of laughter, setting her hand on the counter as she heaved off her own laugher in an attempt to be quiet in public.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 03-Jan-21 01:55 AM
“If I’m Santa, then you can be my elf, hm? Actually, I think elves are taller and notably less Norwegian.” Oskar smirked and gave his own laugh. “As it so happens, I like the beard. I’m gonna keep it whether I look like I’m forty.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Jan-21 02:02 AM
"Wow! Bringing height into this huh? Well laugh it up because that's practically your only one up on me, Muscle Milk. And yeah, weirdly enough, it does suit you. In like a weird young German Santa type. Or a lumberjack." After thanking the cashier, She took their bags down off the counter and began to head for the door. "Also I think elves could totally be Norwegian, You know how close Lofoten is to the North Pole, right?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 03-Jan-21 02:11 AM
“Whatever you say, Sara. I just use height jokes because there’s so many I can make.” Oskar followed her out. “Uh, are you sure you don’t want me to take any of those? At the very least it’s polite to ask.” (edited)
